Reviews.Title: “Not great service”
Reviews.Author: msatrip
Reviews.Content: After a long plane ride into Hong Kong, I arrived at the hotel at 5:00pm to find out that my room was still not ready and would not be for another hour, although check-in was supposed to be three full hours before I arrived. I was told that I could have two complimentary drinks at the rooftop bar while my room was being cleaned. When I got up to the bar, I was told I could only have complimentary soft drinks but would have to pay for my wine. Not a great welcome for a hotel guest. Once in the room, I ordered 24 hour WiFi access for 140 HKD and hooked up my laptop. I then tried to hook up my phone to the same service and was told I would have to pay another 140 HKD because it is a different device- ridiculous. Nowhere in the Terms and Conditions did it state that the rate of 140 HKD per day applies per device, and this is not the norm in most hotels. In fact, most hotels offer free WiFi service to begin with, let alone charge guests for each device. The room was a decent size and the bed was comfortable. The floor of the bathtub was peeling and the shampoo/soap in the bathroom was not replaced until the fourth day of our stay. The breakfast spread is average but the service in the restaurant is quite good. The concierge is not very knowledgeable and does not offer to call a venue when he is not sure about it, as they typically do in other hotels worldwide. Overall, the hotel is clean and comfortable but the level of service is not up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Good Location, Best Hotel in Causewaybay area”
Reviews.Author: kim511
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza Hotel is located one block behind Times Square. Room is great with good furnishing and room size is considered big when compared with average hotel room in Hong Kong. Location is good as there are various restaurants and convenient stores around the hotel. It takes 5 minutes walk to Times Square, 10 minutes walk to SOGO department store, 10 minutes walk to MTR subway station, 15 minutes walk to 24 hours supermarket. If you really have to stay around Times Square area in Causewaybay, this is the hotel you should consider.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideTravellerRo
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me start by saying I would give this 3.5 stars, however since no halfs allowed I deliberated for while (few seconds).... It doesnt get 4 stars as poor recognition on PC Platinum members. It complies with the 'requirement' from IHG, but stops short of being a great hotel. THis is my third visit to this hotel. Location is great in Causeway bay and very close to Times Square and major shopping malls. Rooms are also very nicely appointed and modern. One point of note which I see in many comments as a positive, but I have another negative side to add. The Bathroom has a huge glass shower which looks into the bedroom and bathroom, but through from the bedroom side, when you are sitting on the toilet, imagine if your partner/lover/colleague could see you in the compromised position, which is the case here. In my case it wasn't a problem, as I have always wanted to see my other half like that :) No access to club lounge for Platinum members, very strange. Seems like the hotel uses this as a means to get people to spend more money - room upgrade sir? Pool area is quite small, but very nice on the roof level. However for a hotel of this size it has 5 sun beds, two in the pool (nice), two outside and another miles away. Breakfast not included in room (very strange for Platinum again!) and very expensive.... however nearby shops and starbucks fill that need for a fraction of the price. Very nice hotel, but could be oh so much nicer. The hotel room incidentally would get 4-5 Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bruce M
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel and the staff were lovely and so helpful (one of them even wrote us a little personal note and left it for us on our departure to say what a pleasure it was to know us and that she hoped we'd be back). We had a club room on a high floor overlooking the Happy Valley racecourse and the mountains behind it. Hong Kong had a really bad Typhoon only the day before we arrived and it was still very wet and wild. The view over the mountain with the surrounding clouds was terrific. Our room had a glass wall in the bathroom so that you could shower and look through that glass wall to the window and beyond to that beautiful view. There was also a sliding panel that shut off that glass wall if you needed privacy. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: ThiesHH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really good, the room was great and also nothing to complain about the service. The price for this hotel was as well okay. However, it seems, that the bar on the rooftop is quite popular and that caused sometimes, that you had to wait ages for the elevator. And sometimes the elevator was full. This was really annoying! Otherwise nothing to complain

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: akentmm
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and modern and close to transport. Great location for Happy Valley - you can sit and have a cocktail overlooking the course. However, it is therefore a little less central for transit points and the main hussle and bussle. Though taxis are cheap. Rooms are good but breakfast not great.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: PEMtheDane
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is conveniently located in the Causeway bay area of Hong Kong. It is predominantly a business-type hotel. They have a very small gym at the top floor and an outdoor pool on the rooftop - unfortunately the pool is right next to the bar where people sit and eat and drink whilst looking at you in the pool. This is very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: trhahn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza Causeway Bay from June 30-July 23, 2012 while in Hong Kong for a short-term business assignment. I arrived in the middle of the night on June 30th and was shocked when I discovered the manager had waited until my arrival before going home for the night. The staff was wonderful during my entire stay, going as far as asking what my favorite fruit was so that they could have a fresh basket for me every day! The room was large and perfect for the average business traveller or couple. The furniture and fixtures were also modern, clean, and comfortable. The location of this hotel is perfect, regardless of your plans while in Hong Kong. It's a two-minute walk to the MTR and Times Square. Being in Causeway Bay means you have access to every type of shopping imagineable. The gym of the hotel looks over the Happy Valley Race Course. I was lucky enough to be on the treadmil during the last race of the season and got to view it for free! My one negative view of the hotel was the housekeeping. Since I was staying for so long, I thought it was unnescessary to have someone clean and tidy my room on a daily basis. I asked the housekeeper if they could serivce my room twice a week, but apparently that wasn't allowed. Instead, I was forced into keeping my "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door at all times. This resulted in a daily message indicating that they tried to service my room. For most people this wouldn't be a problem and in the end it really wasn't that big of a deal. I was more annoyed by the fact that they wouldn't accomodate such a simple request. The hotel is expensive from a US perspective, but it is reasonable for Hong Kong. I would definately recommend this hotel to everyone I know looking for a great place to stay while in visiting Hong Kong. I would also encourage everyone to joing their Priority Rewards program as you get benefits just for signing up, even if you have no status.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong service at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Pablo
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel in the Happy Valley area of Hong Kong, next to the Race Course - so there is a bit of green open space within walking distance and a walking jogging route around the track. Hotel is really comforable, great helpful staff, a couple of nice restaurants, and a roof top bar with a Happy Hour 5 -7 (2for1). There is a gym at the top with great views and a reasonable sized pool. Close to the Causeway Bay metro station (5mins) which has a massive Mall and load of restaurants to choose from, as has most of Hong Kong. Great Hotel, great price in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glend
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights. The hotel is well placed near MTR station, tram lines(happy valley route outside door!). Its also only about 10-15min walk from Star line's Wan Chai terminus. Staff were very welcoming and could not do enough to help you. I booked a premium room which whilst expensive gave you free wi-fi, breakfast and evening drinks. The room was big and very clean with views over Happy Valley race course to die for!! Breakfast was nothing to write home about with the fresh yogurt machine only operating until 9am!?!? and the same with the omelette chief?? Why?? My only grip was as soon as I checked out my wifi log in was dumped and as I had a late flight was with out wifi, also soft drinks which had been free on my package were very very expensive once I had checked out. My college in a hotel round the corner continued to have free wi-fi in lobby and was given continued lounge access til his flight time! I had paid more for the Crowne Plaza! So on the whole I felt a little cheated at the price especially when I had arrived in the middle of the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muigay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay for 3 nights on our recent trip to South East Asia. We booked the hotel because of its central location and we were not disappointed. The hotel is literally steps from Times Square and lots of restaurants (cheap local meals to more upscale restaurants). It is very close to the MTR. We didn't get a chance to have cocktails at the rooftop bar like people suggested but the next time we are in HK, we'll be sure to check into the hotel again. The only downside to our stay was the front desk staff not being very helpful when we were asking for direction and sightseeing suggestions. Fortunately, husband and I both speak and read Chinese so we were able to navigate the city well on our own afterall. Just think that they should also pay equal attention to Asian guests, not just the obvious out-of-towners

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: SihuiLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 night at Crowne Plaza. Check-in was a little slow. Although I arrived past check-in time (and indicated my ETA), my room was not ready and had to wait for an hour. Other than that, room was spacious, clean and just perfect. Hotel staff are polite, very willing to help. Location of the hotel was just perfect; 10min walk from the malls and quite a few eateries along the street. Fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Doesnt get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: carol967
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location, 1 block away from all the causeway bay shops and a large shopping centre (air con!). There is a huge supermarket and food hall within this centre which is handy if you dont agree with mini bar prices. The hotel itself provides huge bedrooms and the breakfast is fabulous. there is a massive buffet selection of hot and cold, anything you might want regardless of culture. they cook eggs and pancakes to order too. They screwed up our rooms however, and it was near impossible to get them to understand what we were saying. That said, we enjoyed our stay. I am always amazed at the prices charged for hotel rooms in HKK, I would say it must be the most expensive place in the world for rooms.?

Reviews.Title: “On of the best in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: dorycook
Reviews.Content: Awesome rooftop pool....complimentary VOSS looking mineral water daily is very generous. No fuss lobby and no fuss checking in and out. Rooms are awesome too. Well appointed, modern and very functional. Shower/bath is well designed and again very functional. The view of Happy Valley Racecourse is definitely a bonus. Only lowdown is the elevator being a bit slow, internet not being cheap and weird positioning of the pedestrian road outside. Otherwise, for the price, this hotel is just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “HKG-Crowne Plaza HK, rm2108 (exec)”
Reviews.Author: Lance-Travellot
Reviews.Content: 3rd time here. Excellent location, within 10mins walk to Time Square area, Was upgraded to an Exec room, which was slightly larger than the smallish standard room. However the view was of a shabby building on opposite side of the road. Hardware in the room was excellent. They even have a powered USB port in at the desk. Downside was the check-in where they did not explain to me that I had to pay extra to avai myself of drinks and snacks on the "club lounge". The lounge is also the restaurant/bar on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: nettyli
Reviews.Content: Great location in Causeway, 7 min walk to underground, close to lots of restaurants and Times Square. Bus stops are right in front of the hotel and cabs are easy to flag down on the street. The Happy Valley racecourse is a 5 min walk away, which is a greta place for an outdoor run. Rooms and bathroom are very spacious. Very clean. Beds are extremely comfortable. Gym is sufficient. Small, but has all the basics, and great views. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, Great Food in Causeway Bay, but what happened to the lobby?”
Reviews.Author: IndyGuynside
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay is an inviting property with much to offer tourists and business travelers. The expansive rooms – by Hong Kong standards – are equipped with modern technology and amenities to include a convenient charging station for most mobile phones, iPod interface, audio distribution via a room speaker system and an above average LG flat screen. Towels are fluffy, beds are comfortable and the room contained those nice-to-haves such as an ironing board, iron, clothes brush and umbrella. The location in Causeway Bay is a short walk from the MTR station and Times Square for shopping and to the Hong Kong Jockey Club. There are a number of restaurants in the area making this a stand-out hotel in the area. Food is good here with the 1st floor restaurant serving a lovely breakfast and dinner buffet. Staff are attentive, helpful and friendly, but somewhat pushy to let you know their name so you include it on the evaluation form. I suspect that leads to browne points....nothing wrong with that. Kudos to the staff for taking care of guests during Typhoon Vincente; they did a great job. I have stayed at this property a couple of times, so understand my dismay when last week I arrived to find the lobby bar replaced by a tacky high end home accessory store. While I suppose there is more money to be made selling this stuff, eliminating this lobby gathering space has really struck a blow to what was a really nice hotel. Now there is no place to meet for business or even gather unless you take the lift to the top floors. And even there, those venues are poorly designed for a business meeting one being outside. And while I was there one of the bars was closed to accommodate a private group, forcing everyone to the outside bar in dreadful weather. The business center moved to what is basically a couple of tables off the lobby, barely meeting the description. The lobby now consists of one unisex bathroom and strangely designed low to the ground seating which looks nice, but is uncomfortable and inadequate. This hotel in my view now moves down several notches on the scale of functionality and is just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: Really nice rooms with very modern TV, entertainment etc and fantastic bathrooms with rain showers! Really appreciated them on our stopover in Hong Kong on the way to Europe. Very convenient location for the metro and the attractions of Causeway Bay / Central area. An easy walk to Times Square. Friendly and very helpful staff with baggage and local advise etc. Very classy and modern hotel, I would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A memory stay”
Reviews.Author: DreamCountry
Reviews.Content: It' my 2 time stay at CPHK, i have to say that it's a really nice hotel, good location-2 minutes walk to Times Square in Causeway Bay, and many boutique around Times Square, Recommend that you should go to Xin Yin Kee restaurant(local food)-2 minutes walk at right side of the hotel. reservation-I have booked from website, and i called to hotel to check the reservation,Eva who pick up my phone,Very polite, quick answered my question. also you can free enjoy breakfast as you are an ambassador menber(IHG Hotel menber),This treatment in the intercontinental hotel sometimes doesn't have it, therefore it was over value. Arrival Experience-the staff show me to the PCR check in counter when i arrival hotel, they prepared everything before i arrival, and i was told that i have upgrade to the corner suite because it's my wedding anniversary, it's really surprised and delighted me. Room-it was very big for a suite, face to the Happy Valley, you can see the full view.Could see that The hotel management is very seriously to the hotel the maintenance that looks the room quite new. Service-after 5 minutes when i go to the room, room service staff send a bottle of champagne to my room to congratulations on our anniversary,it's surprised and delighted me again. Chef Conierge Tony- booked the a nice restaurant with local culture, but i didn't caught up because the bed weather, but thanks to Tony anyway. Breakfast-the quality as usual,very good and fresh,All kinds of style breakfast term you collocation, i have tryed american in first day and hongkong style in second day. Privilege as PA-Buffet breakfast served from 6:00am until 10:30am daily at Kudos located on 1st floor Evening drinks and exquisite snacks from 5:30pm until 8:00pm daily at the rooftop bar Club @28 Complimentary coffee, tea, standard soft drinks and juices from 9:00am until 8:00pm at Club @28 24-hour in-room Broadband Internet access Complimentary outgoing local calls and local facsimiles Complimentary AT&T and toll free calls 15% discount on buffet dining at Kudos 15% discount on laundry, pressing and dry cleaning services (excluding express service) I think the service in CPHK is better than ICHK, Let me feel comfortable, warm, like stay in home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service from the moment you enter the front door”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at crowne plaza hotel in Hong Kong. Bell boy / Porters were very helpful, there is this one guy by the name of Budi, he's the guy u shud look for advice on where to eat. I find him very helpful and polite during our stay for 6 nights. Check in staff were also polite and provide speedy check in service. The standard room was huge compare to others, a nice Phillips LCD TV + Phillips DVD Player And sound system. The breakfast buffet selection everyday looks the same, this is the only negative side. But hey, for me i will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: vonireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot. Close to the MTR if you have a business meeting in Central, close to Times Square if you need to go shopping and close to Wan Chai if you need a night out. The rooms are nice, well appointed and very clean - great shower too. The rooftop bar is lovely, although £4 for a small diet coke seemed excessive, and pack your swimming trunks for a refreshing half hour. Would I come back? Well this was my third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: arnab1978
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza in Causeway Bay is my preferred choice for hotels in Hong Kong Island since I am a platinum member of Priority Club. The rooms are clean and well designed. The suites are some of the best I've stayed in at typical business hotels. The location is great with Times Square and Causeway Bay subway station only a short walk. The service has always been good, especially for regular guests like myself. I do miss the club lounge at the 2nd floor which has been converted into a restaurant in the past year though Club 28 is not that bad when not too noisy. Breakfast could be better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location and friendly staff too”
Reviews.Author: michellemarion
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 nights in this hotel. He was on business and I was on leisure. This hotel is suitable for both. The MRT station is just barely 150m away. Right opposite of the hotel is the famous "MAK'S NOODLE". "HUI LAU SHAN" & "HO HUNG KEE" are just one block away from mak's. As you walk towards the MRT station at Times Square, you will see them. Being a priority club member, we were upgraded to a bigger room (corner room), for HK standards, this is a very spacious room. The swimming pool was chic & beautiful. I will definite consider this hotel for my next stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Family or Business”
Reviews.Author: EssexFamily55
Reviews.Content: This is a well priced, well appointed hotel that served as a good base for business in HK and subsequently as family accommodation. I was working Uk hours whilst in HK and was arriving back at the hotel very late, but the rooftop bar was always open and happy to serve. In tthe mornings, the rooftop pool was a welcome distraction. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great room”
Reviews.Author: bradletn
Reviews.Content: Stayed early July for 3 nights with our 5 year old daughter. Easy booking via email. We booked breakfast and wifi package (why anyone should have to pay for wifi in a hotel I dont know). The room was great and fab bathroom with rain shower. Large and modern room and fit the rollout for our daughter in easily. However, we arrived at 1230am after a long flight and the rollaway bed had not been set up in the room as they were waiting for us to check in. It took half an hour for this to arrive which really wasnt excusable. They were also doing renos in the usual breakfast location so breakfast was in the bar on the top floor which had much better views but was quite tight and had a reduced offering. The last morning we had breakfast in the usual restaurant and it was nothing special. The location is great for shopping in Causeway Bay and staff were very friendly. We would stay there again despite the hiccuphs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, close to transport... I'll be back when I'm next in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: emmesse2010
Reviews.Content: I got caught in the rain in the 5 minutes walk from the MTR (Causeway Bay station) to the hotel so I arrived looking like I'd just stepped out of the shower! The staff at reception found me some paper tissues to pat myself down while they quickly checked me in. Service was fast, friendly and with warm smiles. And they have free Chupa-chups at reception! I'd booked a King Bed deluxe with breakfast included. The room was a decent size, spotlessly clean and with a large TV and desk. The bathroom had a bath (with shower attachment) as well as a separate shower with a choice of standard or rainfall settings. I liked how the ipod dock was connected to the room sound system so there was great sound from the large speaker under the TV but I could also listen and control the volume in the bathroom. The bed was possibly the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in - it was a real dilemma whether to leave the bed and go down for breakfast. Breakfast was buffet style and had many options (Asian and Western) I got a delicious scrambled eggs from the egg station and enjoyed the selection of hot food. At check-in, I was told that because I was enrolled in the Priority Club Rewards program (from a previous stay at a Holiday Inn, part of the same hotel group), wi-fi would be complimentary. That was great (and the wi-fi was fast) but I'm baffled about why you'd try to inconvenience guests who hadn't enrolled by charging them an hourly or 24 hour rate for internet access. I'd have been extremely annoyed if I hadn't had complementary wifi. I was also given 2 cocktail coupons for the bar on the top floor. My wife and I enjoyed these - just a pity the weather wasn't good enough to try out the pool next to the bar. The concierge desk helped us confirm ferry times for travel to the mainland and quickly found us a taxi when it was time to leave. I'll definitely return here when I'm next in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business (and shopping!)”
Reviews.Author: GlobalStPaul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Hong Kong for two weeks (for his work and my vacation). We wanted a comfortable hotel that was well-located and that allowed him to work when needed. After one night in a boutique hotel we moved to the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay and didn't want to leave. Highlights included a very comfortable sized room with a great view, full desk/work area, home-style bathroom (including marble everywhere and rain shower), and even surround-sound stereo that played my own iPod music. More important was the great service. The head concierge, Tony, was fantastic - knowledgeable, very friendly and always available. The hotel is located less than 5 minutes walk from the "Times Square" shopping area which is chock full of designer stores and the local MTR (subway) station. This is one hotel we will recommend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned hotel, surrounded by great food options”
Reviews.Author: sspfcm
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 15th floor of this hotel - it was a lovely room with sweeping views, very comfortable king sized bed (we requested this), ipod dock for music, great shower cubicle with stone bench, generously sized basin and vanity area. Food options in the hotel were patchy - buffet breakfast a bit bland and with a conveyor belt feel, we were surrounded by business or conference visitors. But the Chinese restaurant in the hotel was surprisingly good, looked like it would be very expensive but was instead very reasonable for a sublime steamed chicken dish, hot pot eggplant and fried rice. The rooftop bar was great - views were fantastic, inside well appointed, cocktails were not cheap but very nice indeed after a day of sightseeing/ The hotel is walking distance to shops, buses, trains, taxis everywhere - fantastic location for shopping and eating. Front of house service was very good. Overall, staff were responsive and very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: RyRy2003
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights using Priority Club points then upgrading room to Crowne Privilage Room which included breakfast, drinks and nibbles for 2 adults and a rather limited view overlooking Happy Valley. We had to pay AUD$20 extra for 8yr olds breakfast Location was handy to Times Square for shopping and an entrance to MTR. Pool was good for unwinding with the complimentary drinks after days of doing the usual touristy things. Only downside is that twin rooms have single beds so they don't really accommodate for having a child in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: crwibawa
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very convenient and fast as we had booked online they had our details. Took us about 10 minutes or so from check-in and to get to our room. The room itself was really nice and clean. The bed especially was one of the best in terms of its size. The king bed was over 2m in width enabling my wife, child and myself to share the the bed with enough room to turn around. We had breakfast @ kudos, nice pleasant restaurant with an international buffet style breakfast menu and some traditional Chinese food. We went to the pool area that is located on the top floor of the hotel, same floor as the Bar and the gym. Pool is small, but with the view it is a rather relaxing place to be. The gym is also small but is sufficient to do light workouts and the treadmill has a view of the race course. This is more of a business hotel and not so for a family, however the location is perfect, 3 minutes walk from times square, 15 minutes or so walk to SOGO and etc. Over all a nice hotel in a nice location. One thing though that is annoying was the wait especially in the evening for the lifts (a rather small lift) as you would have to compete with people going to the bar on the 28th floor

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Below Average Service and Food”
Reviews.Author: Markus M
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location and the rooms. For us, as vegetarians, the main drawback was the lack of any vegetarian food and the unwillingness of the staff to attend to it. Normally we always have a good breakfast in every hotel we visit, either from the buffet or from some custom made food. However here, we were not able to get anything and had to eat baked beans plus rice for breakfast ... . Another thing which annoyed us was that the chinese restaurant still serves shark fin soup, even though now most of Hong Kongs higher end restaurants and hotels have banned it. Summary, if you are a mainstream traveller we can recommend this hotel, if you have special food needs of any sort than it is better to look for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Veteranito
Reviews.Content: Been there back in February and I think I will be back if I ever visit HK again. Location: Very Good Price: Moderate Check in Service: Standard (check in was a little cold, not much smile, maybe we arrived when at their check-out time) Room Comfort: Excellent (my wife always complaints about the beds from the hotels, but not this one!) Amenities: Wow (they even have a mobile in the room for you to take out. Details you have to stay and try... of course long distance will be charged, but very convenient) F&B: tried their bar twice, it has a very good view. Breakfast with good choice. Check-out: Simple but fast. This hotel will certainly come to my mind if I will visit HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: flatwhitecoffee
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many hotels on the island but this is the cream. Top location, fantastic decor, unbelievable top floor bar and pool. You have to check this out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Ideal for access to MTR”
Reviews.Author: Dubaiwebby
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this Hotel. I found it as good as the first time. It is basically a great buisness hotel, make sure you book the Buisness package, which includes complimentry drinks and snacks in evening on the roof terrace. It is 5 mins from the MTR and has great shopping close by as well as being right next to Happy Valley race track. Would reccomend it to anyone whom is looking for a good value buisness hotel, or on a long weekend city break.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerBasel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crown Plaza for the third year. The hotel was priced more reasonable before but this time it was more expensive so I rated 'low' in terms of value. We would have stayed at the 'W hotel' or similar if I didn't have to stay in Hong Kong island. My husband and I spent 8 nights over the Christmas holidays to visit family. We stayed four nights at the room with racecourse view and four nights at the suite. The staff was generally helpful but not exceptional compared to other hotel in the same price range. Wifi is available with a daily fee. We had breakfast once during our stay but the quality was average so skip it if you have to pay for it (head over to Times Square or happy valley for dim sum or Pacific Place i.e. Conrad Hotel, JW Marriott and Island Shangri-La or Central if you like hotel breakfast for similar price). The suit was spacious, with a guest bathroom, sofa, armchair, etc. The hotel provided each room a mobile phone for local use which was convenient. Great location - only a few minutes walk to Times Square and The Lee Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: woody4buzz
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on a business trip in April this year. chose this one based on the reviews here. this place is very conveniently located in causeway bay, just meters away from time square and happy valley race course (this is a big plus for runners like me). In general, the staff are helpful and service quality is good. However, they are expected for such a 4.5 star hotel. The room is modern and airy with good in-room facilities. Once again, this is expected, particularly for the executive club room. However, some of the facilities are missing such as free access to an executive club lounge and a business conference room which are standard in similar HK hotels. Considering the room rate, this is a bit surprise. Value for money is definitely not on the card for this hotel. The one thing impressed me most is the two restaurants in this hotel, one for buffet and one fine dining. Both of them are superb in terms of the quality of food and service. Even though there are so many fantastic choices for food in the area, i had all my breakfasts in the buffet restaurant and two dinners at the other one. Highly recommend to anyone staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality in Hong Kong, second time”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this nice hotel of Causebay for our second time and we could say that our second stay was better that our first one. Sometimes is not easy to make a choice in Wanchai but the Crowne Plaza is a perfect and wonderfull place to make our business in this dynamic city of Hong Kong. Rooms should be 5 star, beds are very high quality and all the extras in service are in place. Our view is spectacular and the pool at the top is very original. Hong Kong needs places like this, in past not all our stays had been with good value.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent high quality”
Reviews.Author: rblw
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay here for business and always have a great experience. Rooftop bar and pool era is great.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - Good location, friendly staff, clean and value for money”
Reviews.Author: dfisch891
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for four nights whilst visiting Hong Kong. I have no complaints about the hotel and would stay at it again. It’s not a five star hotel (more like a 'strong' four stars), though this shouldn't keep you from booking - unless your look for something like the Ritz or Four Seasons. Some other points: Location - The hotel is a short walk from the Causeway Bay Station, with good links to Central and beyond. It takes about 47 min. from the airport (Airport Express to Hong Kong / Central Station and then the Island Line to Causeway Bay Station), though there is a bit of walking from Hong Kong / Central Station until you arrive at the hotel. Since I had some luggage, I took a cab directly to Hong Kong Station on the way back. There are also plenty of restaurants (there is a Starbucks across the street), bars and shopping (e.g. Times Square) around the property. Friendly staff - Most of the staff spoke good English and they were willing to help out. The Front Desk took care of several reservations, both in Hong Kong and Macau, during our stay. Room - The room and common areas were spotless...the hotel is fairly new. I was upgraded to a room on the 26th floor, which is the Executive Level. The rooms are a little on the small side, though not bad for Hong Kong and the price you are paying. It came with free bottles water (refreshed daily), fruit and Internet. I'm not sure if this was because it’s on the Executive Floor or my status (I'm Platinum). There was a nice view of the city from my room and came with some neat pieces of technology (iPod dock, DVD/CD player, speakers throughout, mobile hotel phone, etc.) Facilities - There are a few restaurants within the hotel, though I did not eat in any of them. I did order room service on a few occasions, which was above average for hotel food (it was certainly better then what I have had at Crowne Plazas in the UK). There is a bar on the 25th floor that is on the same level of the pool. I'd go there for a drink and take a look at the view.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room with spectacular view and service.”
Reviews.Author: Samkeith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza, Causeway bay for 2 nights on a business/leisure visit. As a priority gold, we were upgraded to a suite with a sweeping view of Happy Valley. Everything in this suite was well appointed. The master bathroom has two sinks, a bathtub, a separated shower stall and toilet. The surround sound system is unexpected. The most unexpected features are the USB charger and " the sanctuary" providing all kinds of universal connectors for your mobile devices. The restaurant Kudos could be a little warmer and larger but the food and service made up for the drawbacks. I definitely will return to this hotel again. One last thing, it is convenient located behind Time Square shopping complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cyrille M
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in early May. We were upgraded to the 26th floor with a view over the racecourse. We loved the spotless room and the big bathroom. I only wish the TV had a better selection of channels. The bar on the rooftop is great and if you can make it there for happy hour the better. The reception staff and concierges are really helpful. I think that the concierges should be separated from the reception to make it easier as at times the front desk gets crowded. I must say that by international standard the front desk is quite small. Breakfast is very good and the staff are very efficient. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great sized rooms for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: ph1973
Reviews.Content: Great rooms for a city hotel, well decorated and good amenities. The location is handy for the Causeway Bay Business and shopping areas (which is high end designer). The staff at the hotel are generally helpful. They have Chupa Chups at reception :) The MTR Island Line is very handy. The restaurants are good, but if you are staying here a long time the choice seems a bit limited a daily specials would be good. The buffet dinner is fantastic but it is expensive. My room had great views over Happy Valley. The breakfast is great, I love the cheese and ongoing freshly made omelette. The hotel is very quiet, which i love in a city hotel! But again my room was at the back facing Happy Valley so that may have helped. Cons - the pool area only has 4 or 5 loungers and is next to the bar which has an outside area. The gym is small and way too warm! I need to move out soon to move to an apartment :'(

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, good location in causeway bay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights stay in Crowne Plaza, the service was great, they wont let me wait too long for checking in, since i arrived there 8 in the morning. Just a few steps, nice shops are everywhere, good food also around the corner, the concierge always in a good help and fast finding me taxi and direction to everywhere i want to go...the room was nice, clean and i love the pillow!!!! If you prefer staying around causeway bay then i would recommend this....

Reviews.Title: “Cool urban style in a super location”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot in business and only bother to review hotels if they are worth recommending. This one is a smaller, newer property with rooms, lobby, and public areas in a kind of artsy contemporary style. The gym on top is small, but has an awesome view and a rooftop pool and stylish indoor/outdoor bar. The room was surprisingly large and had a flat screen TV built into the wall and a cell phone I could take with me when I left so I could get calls to my room when I was in the city. The staff and business lounge were also excellent. And of course, the location--near the subway and shopping. Much better than staying on the Kowloon side.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: iwa_17
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza isn't usually among my choice of hotels (I usually prefer something a little more higher end), but I chose to stay here for two nights because I was trying to keep costs down for my business related travel (HK is expensive!) and because it was relatively new. I wasn't disappointed. Service was very attentive and the room was sizable and comfortable. There were nice touches that you would expect from a higher end hotel such as a fruit plate in your room that they refresh every day. Though they don't offer free Internet, they offered an all-you-can-use Internet and breakfast package that you could tack on to your room that saved you a little bit. Breakfast was fairly extensive -- pastries (just ok), fresh juices, eggs etc as well as chinese fare like congee, made to order noodle soup and a small selection of dim sum. I had a problem opening my safe on my last day, and they came to fix it right away. When I told them I needed to go get breakfast right away so I can make a meeting. The manager, who would've preferred I was there, was very accommodating and took responsibility for the security of my things -- she promised to stay while the engineer worked on it, and personally brought me the contents of the safe to the restaurant so I can inspect it and make sure nothing was taken. Location was very good. In fact, I chose it partly because of it -- It's minutes away from the lively Times Square district in Causeway Bay. It's slightly more of a walk to the MRT than I expected, but it's still only about 10-15 min to the train platform. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look any further”
Reviews.Author: 14NABster
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel you want to stay in when in Hong Kong. As soon as you arrive, you feel welcomed and appreciated as a guest. The little things are even taken care of, as nice candy at the reception desk, two mac's for free internet in the lobby. a special open deck floor (5th) for smokers, or just for somebody that would like some fesh air. the rooms are excellent, all in a nice modern design. Especially the glass wall shower is a eye catcher when you first enter the room. I didn't have time to see the top two floors (pool en bar) but what I have heard it is a must see. So next tip will certainly include a swim on the 28th and a cool drink one floor higer. The location is great, with just a short walk to the MRT station, some nice shopping nearby and a Starbucks across the street. I am particular happy with the service. After arriving home, I noticed I left clothing in the closset. I e-mailed to the general info e-mail and recevieved a postive answer within a few minutes. Not somethingI was expecting sending an e-mail to such address. It is for sur a hotel I will revisit, and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deals available”
Reviews.Author: Joanna P
Reviews.Content: The place was good and especially if you like Causeway Bay it is even better. Everything was very satisfactory, but especially as the hotel offers some amazing deals. Based on such deals around there is absolutely nothing to be critisized and all is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A little slack for 4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Scallophunters
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed in this hotel, although the 1st time round I was very impressed with the place, this time round I was a little disappointed. The hotel itself is fine, well located in Causeway Bay and within walking distance to Time Square and MTR and it is surrounded by very nice restaurants. The rooms are roomy and bathroom facilities are above average, also the view from our room was quite nice. The bed has to be said was very nice. The bar by the swimming pool was a nice plus point, its a chic place to be for a drink and a chat with friends. The less impressive things this time round was a toilet that blocked, a dirty bath robe and a less than enthusiastic concierge despite being a platinum member. OK I did get a free upgrade but the service as a whole was very average for a 4.5 star hotel in HK, very average porters as well. Another thing is the TV channels are very mainland Chinese Biased, only 1 Cantonese channel and no free movie channels. Even a small hotel like Hotel de Edge beats this and had a much better choices of channels. Just a very average stay this time for me, certainly didn't set my pulse on fire and the prices are steep for such an experience. They need to try harder.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Stayz
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this well located gem. Great fresh design. Large bathrooms. Friendly staff. Located in the heart of causeway bay's sprawling shopping district. Give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Room Nice and Clean. Great location Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: Optics999
Reviews.Content: Room Nice and Clean. Great location Great Value. Excellent Service.

Reviews.Title: “Good HK hotel”
Reviews.Author: pammyvancouver
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (kids ages 7 & 9). We were in HK for 4 days. Our room had 2 twin beds which we shared (mom with kid 1, dad with kid 2). Decent sized rooms for HK standards. Large bathroom with tub and shower area. The pool was on one of the top floors and was very nice albeit small (small wasn't an issue as it is hardly used). The pool area shares space with the bar which serves some nice buy-one-get-one-free cocktails from 5-9pm (double check the time offered). Good location closely to Times Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor and easy location for Rugby 7's”
Reviews.Author: Passionflower200050
Reviews.Content: This hotels gives what it sells! As part of the ichotels group it is perfectly positioned and the service and food are reflected in this positioning, being that one level below their premier hotels. Check-in was friendly, however a small booking rate issue took some time to sort out and could have been dealt with in a slightly more professional manner so we weren't kept waiting for 15 minutes. We could tell that our check in assistant was really trying to help us, but his manager didn't help matters and should have thought about the situation from the customer view point as the room was ready. Eventually, we went up to our room while it was sorted out with a good outcome. The rooms are very surprisingly well designed and decorated in a contemporary style. The bathroom amenities are more than adequate but the little things are missing eg moisturising lotion. We booked a club floor but were disappointed to find that breakfast was with everyone so the experience was very busy and noisy. Quality of the food was just ok, but not exceptional. The noodle soup was disappointing by Asian standards and better off going across the road to Mac's noodles! These are the small differences between the levels of the hotels that we've experienced. On the up side! this hotel is in a fantastic location, easy access from the airport by public transportation using the airport express and MTR and also for the Rugby 7's. It's a short walk to the ground - so definitely would recommend this hotel and would stay again for this purpose!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: eatshopeatshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night here because as the other hotel was full due to the trade show. New hotel close to times square and the mtr station. Room was modern and spacious with both shower and bath available. We went up to the rooftop bar at night and were highly impressed with the view. Minimum charge is also waived for hotel guests at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “The good & bad in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: Kopite52
Reviews.Content: The staff on the front desk are fantastic - very polite, always smiling and most welcoming. I especially want to mention 'Tony' the Concierge who is very friendly, cheerful and helpful. he's a real asset to the hotel. In contrast I have to say the staff at the 28th floor bar are not the same. They are all a bit 'off-hand' & seem to have an attitude. There is a happy hour on 28th floor bar where you buy one drink get one free and some nights if there's 2 of you and you only want one drink they try to enforce a 'you must order 2 and then get 2 free' rule. We only wanted one drink each and they will bend the rules if you insist but I find this petty 'nickel and dining' of guests very off putting especially when you are a guest in the hotel and paying a lot for a room. The location of the hotel is great - only 10 mins walk (yes it is that far) from Causeway Bay MTR station - looks nearer but there's a long underground walk to the platforms. It's on some good bus routes - the no.10 right outside goes into Central in 10-12 mins. If you want to come back by tram for the experience take the 'Happy Valley' tram only as that drops you right at the lobby. The rooms are great very modern and stylish this is way better then most Crowne Plaza's in the region. It might be the best Crowne Plaza in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, awesome”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel_4075
Reviews.Content: Here I was expecting this hotel to be under rated compared to its sister hotels the intercontinental and it surpassed them both with flying colors . This hotel is awesome, the decor , the rooms, the service , the roof top pool And bar, the food , the breakfast, the location ! The concierge were more than happy to book events and also happy to explain the bear method of transport and talk to the taxi drivers so they took us the right way. They told us what shops to steer clear of , which is good as a lot sell cheap vinyl as leather and cheap junk as gold. Favorite hotel in hong kong and Kowloon , we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, New Hotel, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: ben s
Reviews.Content: Good views of the HK Jockey Club racetrack (hang around for race days and watch the race from your room). Good location in Causeway Bay 2 mins walk from Times Square and 5 mins from the subway. Huge room. Super high ceilings, great bathroom and a shower with a seat in it (for those times you're too hung over to stand up). Great hotel. One of my best Crowne Plaza experiences ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room and location”
Reviews.Author: serap
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Crowne Plaza are brilliant - they have everything you need in them, are spacious, clean and the bathroom is huge (look for the button that changes the shower to a waterfall one). The hotel is well placed, just minutes away from Times Square - we stayed in TST for the second part of our trip, but I much preferred this location, as it is a short walk from the action, but relatively quiet. My criticisms are to do with the cost of everything within the hotel - from the bar snacks to the wifi, it is all far too overpriced. If I am already paying so much for a room, I expect free wi-fi at least.That being said, there are computer stations in the lobby that you can use FOC for half hour at a time. I would come back here (but go elsewhere for cocktails!).

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terryl-55
Reviews.Content: I had been in the US and UK on Business for a month and was meeting my wife in Hong Kong for a holiday on my way home. I had ample Priority Club points so we decided to indulge ourselves at the Crowne Plaza at Causeway Bay and it was a great decision. If this is not a new hotel it is certainly well maintained. The rooms are large and luxurious with a very high standard of amenities. The Club Floor on the roof is where you will find the pool and the main bar, High Tea is served from 3pm and Happy Hour starts at 5pm and if you have taken the Club Floor package it is all free along with WiFi (unlike the US and Canada it is billed separately in other parts of the world). The Hotel itself is great but it is the location that make it a real winner, squeezed in between the Happy Valley Race Course and the Times Square Shopping Centre in Causeway Bay you have a Tram stop outside the hotel front entrance and the Causeway Bay MTR station about a 10 minute walk away. You can walk to the Wan Chai Ferry Pier in 15 minutes and on the way pass more great restaurants then you could hope to try out in a month. This place is on my list as a must stay for Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, mixed service, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: OverseasTravel2
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a reasonable hotel for the price, if you avoid the food (simply awful at best). Check in was a mix up. We chose the CP as it was well located to the sevens rugby stadium. The view is interesting over the Happy Valley racecourse and the room is well sized and appointed. Wifi was not included but reasonably priced. The service was mixed from unfriendly through to thoroughly gracious and accomodating (second try at a late check out was no issue). The food was a separate issue and greatly weighs the score down - a small plate of hors d'oeuvres at the pool bar consisted of a party sausage cut into pieces on a skewer with some peanuts, and an indebile prawn - later that day a plate of salt and pepper calamari was pre frozen rings fried within an inch of burnt and a burger for one friend led to stomach cramps and a night in the bathroom. Unacceptable for a purported 4 star hotel. The pool was a lovely touch and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Close to racetrack/rugby”
Reviews.Author: RoadRunner79
Reviews.Content: First trip to Hong Kong. Business. Golden Valley racetrack next to hotel. Incredible place to run/walk. Watched some rugby. Hotel bar and restaurant were outstanding. Open air view from 27th floor happy hour incredible. Try the breakfast buffet. Sushi in the morning, along with quail eggs and fried noodles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: 3GDude
Reviews.Content: I've previously been a fan of the Excelsior simply because it was a better value and I loved the Dickens pub in the basement. But the Excelsior has aged, and not that gracefully. Just a few blocks away is this very nice Crowne Plaza. It's a bit more pricey but the rooms are definitely more upscale. The location is just as good, right across from the streetcar line and just 1 block from the Times Square entrance to the Causeway Bay metro station. And if you get a room with a view of the racetrack, you can actually sit in your room and watch the horse races on Wednesday night. Of course, it's much more fun to actually go to the track. Breakfast was very good, and if you have Club access, from 5-7:30 you get free drinks and snacks on the 28th floor. The gym is average, a few aerobic machines, some weights and a universal. Pool is very nice just outside the 28th floor club. The service was excellent. In fact, this was WAY above average for a Crowne Plaza, it felt more like an Intercontinental service level. I'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mkjr
Reviews.Content: Having come from the Mandarin Oriental, I am very happy with the rooms at this property and the service. In my view, the location is perfect for a first time visitor in Hong Kong. I only wish the prices were as good as they were a few years ago...oh well. I did not really want to stay in any other hotel and in fact, chose to stay here over the Shangri-La in Kowloon which I could get for less because of the location. Was upgraded to a room with a view of the races but we were at them so it did not make much difference. I would return again in a heartbeat. I also had the buffet. Price was nice and I think it was a little better than the MO personally... ;-) The Juk was better and had more toppings and had a better variety of dim sum.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: hirondelle11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel Hong Kong Causeway Bay for 9 nights while visiting our daughter who is studying at the Polytechnic University of Hong Kong. We chose this hotel for its location and also because of all the positive reviews and we couldn't have made a better choice! It is within walking distance to the underground, a modern mall and lots of small shops and restaurants. I had booked an Executive Room through the hotel website.The website guarantees the best available rate and if you find it cheaper on any other travel site, the first night is free! Our room was very spacious with a comfortable King Size bed and a view over the racecourse. The Executive Room rate included breakfast, free WiFi and a daily newspaper. Breakfast consisted of Asian and European/American food. Service was very good. Especially the Indian chef Sayeed who prepared the eggs went out of his way to fulfill our wishes and always had a smile and a friendly word. A special compliment goes also to the friendly man who cleaned our room 1607. Every day we returned to a perfectly made up room after breakfast while in other hotels our room was often still unmade in the afternoons when we came back tired and in need of a rest. The only slight complaint I have is the thin room door. You can hear your neighbor leave or other guests chat when they come home. Also the lobby is tiny - there are no comfortable chairs to sit, but this is obviously simply due to lack of space. We were very happy with our choice and will definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay again during our next stay in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property in the heart of Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: This property appears to be very new and is well-located in Hong Kong. Easy access to shopping, dining and transportation. I was provided very gracious service upon check-in and allowed to check in early. The room is simply fantastic - very clean, modern and functional. I had a beautiful view of Happy Valley. The breakfast buffet was fantastic with a great selection of Chinese and western breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “one night in hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Brandon228
Reviews.Content: rates were pricey around 500 singapore dollars so Lanson place might have been a better alternative as nearby...However, i was pleased that the accommodation was modern & comfy . I had a good night's rest to prepare me for a full day of meetings & being on my feet. Front desk offered me a late 2pm check out which unfortunately i had no chance to utilize. Ditched my bags by checking into airport express IFC at 7am the next morning. This allowed me to move freely all day before my evening flight. Nice hotel , will definitely check for off-peak rates for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeyondRachel
Reviews.Content: I used to work in Hong Kong for one year and a half, loved it so much and would go back from time to time. Hotels in HK are usually very expensive and small, this time I booked two nights using my priority club points and it was great experience. Causeway bay is undoubtfully the most convenient place on HK island no matter what you want to do. The room was spacious, especially considering it's in HK and like any hotel under intercontinental series, everything was in the right place. It's one of the best among the dozen hotels I've stayed in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location if you stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Chien
Reviews.Content: Rooms are decent sizes compared to similar hotels in Hong Kong. But this is one of the best location (yes, compare to even Admiralty and Tsim Sha Tsui) you can have in Hong Kong. Literally within walking distance to Times Square and Happy Valley Race Course. The bar at the top of the hotel is a must-go as it provides a good relaxing place for drinks after work. Weekends could get crazy as there are young folks who reserved the place for swimming parties. The only negative part is if you want a harbor view, this is not the hotel you want. You have to look at hotels located at Admiralty or Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd times...”
Reviews.Author: Patfootprints
Reviews.Content: And it won't be my last time. That would say it all, wouldn't it ? The room layout and specially the pipe-in music system, I just love it. Short walk to Times Square. Free internet for loyalty members. Ant there is provided cell phone that you can use while you are roaming in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyB_au
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights on a business trip. Nice and central to everything I needed, very close to HK Jockey club if that's your thing, walking distance to the bars etc in Wan Chai. Restaurant was very good, excellent food. Bar on 28th floor was also good for a drink or a meeting with friends. Food was good there too. Internet access was included in my rate and the speed/accessibility was pretty good. My only issue was that it was a very cold week in Hong Kong when I was there and the heating in the hotel room really struggled to get above 19 degrees. On the whole, I was happy and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: erkoSydney
Reviews.Content: CP Causeway Bay is a very good hotel in a great location. It is well run, and the buffet breakfast and roof top bar are fanastic. For some reason i could never seem to get the room the right temperature, but that might have been just me! Would stay again though, its probably a 4.5 star international hotel, and a new and well run one at that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but false club lounge”
Reviews.Author: iwishiwasonvacation
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of the CP chain but I have to say the rooms here are very nice. The service is on par with a holiday inn, the staff hardly smile. It's either because the a) they are not paid well or b) bad training. I think it is both. The hotel does not have a club lounge. It has a rooftop bar which gives executive room guests club benefits. I think this is misleading. I was shocked when I arrived at the hotel and asked to be whisked to the club lounge for check-in and they said they do not have a staff to me in at the lounge. However, I enjoy the rooms as they have large beds and bathrooms. The fittings are pricey, HansGrohe and Kohler fittings. Location is perfect for travelers wanting connections on the MTR, trams and buses to Central. Good for business and shoppers. I recommend this hotel but travelers wanting easy access to public transport but hate the Central district.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dhabi10
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Crowne Plaza Hotels that my husband and I have stayed in. Rooms are immaculately clean and location is excellent - just across from Times Square so relatively near to a metro station! I would defo recommend the Club lounge as the view from the rooftop terrace is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located!”
Reviews.Author: Awaara
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel on my first trip to Hong Kong. The location of this hotel is ideal for any traveller as it is very close to the prime shopping areas and one can do a lot of things after stepping out of thehotel. The hotel lobby looks a bit cramped due to shortage of space, but the feeling goes away when one enters the rooms. The rooms are spacious and the accessories kept there are very well thought of from a travellers view point. Shopping attractions like Times Square and SoGo are few minutes walk from the hotel and there is a lot of street shopping also possible in the vicinity. The room rates seemed a bit high (especially since it did not include breakfast), but then Hong Kong is an expensive city! I had a good view from my room of the neighbouring CCC club which has a race course and multiple sports facilities. There are lot of eating options nearby. There is a metro station at Times Square which makes commuting easy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: link0503
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Jan 14 - Jan 16 of 2012. This hotel is conveniently located, it is literally 100 yards away from Time Square and MRT. Hotel has exercise facility, pool and restaurant. All reasonably pricing. If return to Hong Kong, will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: fourstardust
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a number of hotels in Hong Kong it can be hard to find something that strikes a good balance between value for money, service and facilities - for me this hotel gets that balance just right The rooms are of a good size with great attention to detail such as the surround system and iPod dock The rooftop swimming pool and bar are a great place to relax after a hectic day around the city

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly service, easy access”
Reviews.Author: pelachi
Reviews.Content: I have to confess that I tried my hardest to be very critical of this hotel because I used to be a platinum card member but for various reasons (including the poor service of their customer relationship management team in corporate, not at this hotel) I am no longer a platinum member so I used my points to stay here for free. I took the train in from the airport and decided to take the subway to the hotel. The walk from the Causeway Bay subway station was not easy - it was confusing even with GPS from my iphone and I thought, in my own evil way, "Great - I can say the location is no good". But in reality, the location is very reachable by taxi, which are plentiful and super convenient by bus (I didn't know until I got there). The hotel is located next to the Happy Valley race track and the Causeway Bay area itself is quite a lively and happening shopping and entertainment district. It is a short taxi ride to Wanchai and a slightly longer ride to Central but, as I found out, you can take the bus from right outside the hotel (#690) and this will take you through Wanchai into the heart of Central. The reception area was tidy and efficient, not grandiose like many hotels. The hallways were a little narrow and dark but once you enter the room, it is beautiful. The room was one of the nicest rooms I've stayed in whilst in Hong Kong. It was a good comfortable size (unlike the Sheraton - where I am a platinum member) or even the Intercontinental (both Grand Standford and the main Intercontinental do not have rooms as nice as teh one I stayed in - forget about the holiday inns). The room reminded me a little of the rooms at Le Meridien Cyberport, including the little seating ledge in the shower. Didn't try any of the restaurants due to time restrictions. Don't know about value as I stayed using points.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern room with modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: lilitaly1
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations, bed, location, shower, service & decor!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: WilliamdeBurgh
Reviews.Content: I recently had a two night stay at this hotel and it was excellent. I'm lucky enough to have (legitmate) access to the Intercontinental Hotel Group's friends and family rates which meant our Superior Room was at an even better rate. Our room was very spacious (even for three). The King size bed was exceptionally comfy and the extra bed in our room wasn't bad to sleep on either. The room came equipped with everything that we needed and more. Things provided included dressing gowns, slippers, an umbrella, jogging map and international convertor. Mineral water is also provided and is re-stocked daily. The rain shower (normal shower head is also provided) with view through the room to the outside was an interesting feature. I would recommend a superior for couples for this reason alone. A screen is provided for privacy. The hotel staff were extremely attentive and helpful and there was always someone around when required. The majority spoke English which made communicating very easy. A stay at the hotel wouldn't be complete without a visit to the rooftop heated pool (26C on the day of my visit) which has an excellent view of the surrounds. A rain shower is also nearby which proves refreshing and warm in the winter wind. Also on floor 28 is an exercise room which has treadmills, cross trainers and weights available for use. It overlooks Happy Valley so is worth the visit if your room has a city view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay ....”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: We have corner room 1801 overlooking the Happy Valley racecourse. The view is nice, watching the sport on the racecourse and the action around it. The room is well equipped, excellent wifi, great working desk, it is big enough in my opinion. Bed is comfy and excellent pillows. Nice LCD Tv with DVD and IPOD connectivity with a really great sound system to listen to your tunes in the bath etc and blast them out in your room. Pool & gym upstairs is small buy very adequate. Staff are very friendly, opening doors, lifts with a smile and making sure your needs are covered. Haven't tried breaky, like to go out and find local cafes, plenty around here. The best part of this hotel is its so super quite, that is great and the curtains black out the room for your sleep ins. I really like this hotel and would go down as one of my top rated hotels on my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Mitchie1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 2 years old. It's modern feel and cool room design, along with two outdoor bars, makes a great location for business and pleasure alike. The shower and bedroom is only separated by a glass screen, and the surround sound system compes with iPod connectivity and DVD player. It's a short walk from Times Square, so the underground is close by. Priority Club members enjoy a separate check in area and complementary Internet PC's. The service is excellent, staff extremely helpful and polite. The breakfast buffet is great with American, European and Asian specialities alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great base if you want to explore Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: doverproperty
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is comfortable and located in a quiet corner of Causeway Bay - if you are planning to come by MTR, note that the hotel is very close to Times Square but unfortunately the train station can be quite unforgiving if you are carrying big luggages and facing a large crowd everywhere you go! Take the cab! Service is consistently good! = ) The pool is small though and could be better if there was some privacy (there is a restaurant beside it). The gym s very small though.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Causeway Bay!”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowlad
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here for 3 nights in early Jan. As the main trip purpose was Lunar New Year shopping and meeting my sister who stays in Wan Chai, we decided on Hotel Crowne Plaza due to the good corporate room rate, it's proximity to causeway bay and Times Square. The recent positive reviews on Tripadvisor also helped in our choice. It was 12 deg C when we arrived in HK on 5 Jan. After a short 30 mins ride on the Airport Express, we arrived at HK station (terminal station). As I bought the return airport express tickets online at HKD160 per person (HSBC credit card promotion), I collected the tickets from the Customer Service Counter before exiting the station. A short taxi ride from HK station to the hotel costs HKD32. Check in was prompt and efficient. The guest room at 34 sq m is clearly one of the most spacious we have seen for HK and also one of the most well equipped: iPod/iPhone docking station, in-room mobile and ample sockets. Bed is comfortable and everything still looks new. Across the road from the hotel are small eateries where we had our breakfasts. Our favorite Chi Kei wanton noodle restaurant at 52 Russell St, is 5 mins walk away. Our meal for 3 consisting costs HKD 110. Another plus point especially for guests with young children is the gift of Chuppa Chup lollipops at the Concierge. We had a most enjoyable stay and for those who love shopping in Causeway Bay this is the place to stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Gradual deterioration in what was a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelist8
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular visitor of the Crowne Plaza since it opened it's doors .I had always regarded the hotel to be good value given it's excellent rooms for a Cauesway Bay location.However things just keep changing to the detriment of what was a good property.firstly the Club Lounge which was excellent was removed and replaced with a Chinese Restaurant.The lounge was then incorporated into the ground floor bar,this has now also been replaced with a home wares shop and refreshments for club patrons has moved to the pool bar.soon this will go and probably along with Kudos the only real F& B outlet in the hotel. Room rates have increased lately at an extraordinarily high rate in fact it is possible to achieve the same or slightly lower rates at the Intercontinental in Kowloon.in fact I just achieved such for my next visit to Hong Kong. Next Priority points required to redeem a room have just increased from 25000 points per night to 35000,once again certainly not in line with other hotel clubs ie Hilton ,Marriott and SPG.far quicker to redeem points for rooms at the Conrad hong Kong than Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay given the huge surge in points now required by Priority Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Causeway Bay area”
Reviews.Author: Tamszee
Reviews.Content: We travel to HK fairly often and usually stay at the Excelsior simply because of its location - the Excelsior rooms are fairly run down and in desperate need of refurbishment, but that is a story for another day. We were unable to get a decently priced room at the Excelsior this time because of a fairly last minute booking, and went with the Crowne Plaza instead, so this was our first time here. It was a very pleasant surprise. Location-wise it is not situated smack in the middle of Causeway Bay like Excelsior, but slightly out of the way (it is near Times Square and the MTR exit at Times Square, but those familiar with HK will know that there is a longish walk through an underground tunnel from the Times Square exit to actually get to the main MTR station). This was the only downside. We took three deluxe rooms during the stay. All were very spacious, very new, clean, and had the latest in amenities like ipod docking stations, large flat screen tv. Beds were very comfy, not too hard or too soft. Sheets were incredibly smooth and silky. Bathrooms were large and well-appointed with both shower and bath (I should point out that although there is an option to have a see through glass panel between the shower and bedroom, there is a wooden sliding door which can be pulled over the panel if you prefer your privacy in the shower). The welcome platter of fruit was a nice touch. Reception was helpful though slightly slow on the uptake (we communicated with them in English), and although we had asked for a slightly complicated rooming arrangement with regard to our connecting rooms, this was arranged with no fuss at all, as was a late checkout on the last day. The pool is small, really just for lounging in. The rooftop bar gives a great view of the city if you can see through the smog when you are there! We didn't try the food in the hotel - it looked pricey, but there are choices galore in the vicinity and throughout HK. All in all a very good hotel for the price, especially in an expensive city like HK. Highly recommended, and we will definitely be back if prices stay as they are.

Reviews.Title: “It just works!”
Reviews.Author: thebung
Reviews.Content: Brilliant - newly renovated and everything is carefully thought out and works really well. Great quality fittings, excellent size room for HK, huge in fact, and a superb location for shopping in Causeway Bay - one small block from Time Square. One block to MTR to everywhere. Lovely bed, bathroom with a twist, and so forth and so on. Could have replaced our fruit everyday, I think it was only a welcome plate. TV and phone on desk was not "on" but a quick visit from the handy man fixed it instantly. A cool, hip and funky hotel but not a try hard - we will definitely return. Thank you Crowne Plaza - a good find! Check-in and check out was fast and efficient. Not too noisy air-con, and cool crisp non-dehydrating air - a rarity. iPod dock linked to in-room surround sound system. You will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable for business”
Reviews.Author: Judds09
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor in the bedroom and well designed considering the space minimal. Rooms are always clean. The swimming pool on the roof is really only an aesthetic feature as we found it is always very windy and very public - the pool is basically in the middle of the hotel roof bar with a little gym area tucked around the back so not exactly a fitness area. However it makes for a very beautiful spot in the evening if you're looking for a place to unwind with dramatic views of hong kong. The location is near time square shopping centre and the metro so quite handy if you can overlook its nearness to some of the seedier areas of Hong Kong. Restaurant variety is a bit limited as most are in Time Square and of the shopping centre variety. My only gripe would be with my check-in experience as they always seem to some mistake or a mislaid of my booking every time I check in which isn't the best start. Other than that, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: 1place1dream
Reviews.Content: Room and facility is basic. But the location is great. Right at the Causeway Bay where everything is there from accessibility for business or leisure, and good after hours relax. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: B-YVR
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza still has a brand new feel and all the rooms were very well designed and thought out. The desk area had a lot of space and many outlets including a USB one. They provided an adaptor for in room use and a cell phone that linked to the room so you could be out and about and get calls that were going to you room directly routed. The beds were nice and the bathrooms were very spacious including a rain shower shower head. The service was good and all staff were very helpful. The hotel is located in Causeway Bay right next to the Happy Valley race course. This is a great location - only a couple blocks from Times Square and the metro station. There is a lot to eat and shop right by the hotel. We had the buffet breakfast one time and that was quite good with a lot of variety offered - both Asian and Western food. The gym is located at the top floor and is well equipped with a nice view. We also went to the bar on the top floor each night before dinner and enjoyed nice happy hour drinks and snacks. The bar staff were very nice and a few of them recognized us night after night. Our only complaint was that the lobby sometimes smelt funny. Not always but from time to time (perhaps at night) it would smell a bit like sewer water. Overall a good hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Staff on Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: JackMSydney
