Reviews.Content: Our family visited Hong Kong from December 16 to 19 2011. Check in was very efficient and breakfast was excellent. Club floor on Level 28 is a wonderful place to have an evening cocktail, our particular thanks to Kelly Lung at Level 28 who went out of her way to make their guests feel welcomed. The hotel is very conveniently located near Times Square at Causeway Bay and the concierge was most helpful in recommending restaurants nearby. A definite must to return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chinbeng
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 adults and a year-old boy visited HK, 19--23 Dec 2011. Here are some thoughts and experiences from our trip: 1. Crowne Plaza's LOCATION is excellent, being near Causeway Bay MTR station from where you can reach most interesting places in HK conveniently. 2. If you like SHOPPING, the hotel is in a shopping belt anchored by the very popular Times Square; you can spend the rest of your visit here, and will probably still not have covered all the shops. 3. The hotel ROOM My family stayed on the club floor, and as expected, the rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The shower room is large, clean and modern, and has good amenities including robes and large towels. One big plus factor for Crowne Plaza hotels generally is their big and well designed rooms. 4. If good FOOD is important to you, there is a variety of good restaurants near the hotel. --I recommend One Sushi, which is just across from the hotel. It serves a good range of fresh, elegantly made sushi (see picture) and the price is pretty reasonable--HK$800 for 5 persons. A Japanese restaurant, Rakuen, at Tang Lung street off Hennessy Road, on the 12th floor of Circle Tower, is a 12-minute walk from the hotel--the place gives the feeling of a small japanese restaurant; food is not bad but somewhat expensive: HK$ 1500 for 5 adults. The hotel staff recommended the Chinese restaurant just to the right hand side of the hotel （凤城）. We tried the dim sum--it wasn't expensive, HK$ 400 for 5 adults--but I don't recommend this place as the dim sum was blah. There is a wanton noodle restaurant called 池记，along Percival Street, just 3 minutes walk from Times Square. Excellent wanton noodle at down to earth prices; the restaurant is crammed and noisy, but we got used to it. For Chinese visitors, if you want to take "tortoise cream" or 龟苓膏，just go to 恭和堂 which is a few steps away from the noodle restaurant. Choose the cold one. I had the one which was HK$45--yummy. We also tried the Victoria City Chinese restaurant on level 2 of the hotel. The food was good, and the price was astronomical--considering we only had dishes meant for paupers. The decor of the restaurant can be described as non-descript. Breakfast is at Kudos which is on the hotel's 1st Floor. It's a competent restaurant and, like most good Asian hotels, serve both decent Asian and international cuisines. The staff in this restaurant were very helpful and friendly. On the second morning of our stay, they already knew who we were when we went for our breakfast. 5. Hotel STAFF When I arrived, I discovered that the Club Lounge had been changed to Victoria City Chinese restaurant. Guests on club floor rooms are supposed to enjoy "club lounge" facilities. With the lounge gone, management has made a lame effort to provide "the same benefits" for those staying on the Club Floor. It was not comparable to the experience as I had in other Crowne Plaza or Intercontinental hotels. I conveyed my disappointment to the hotel GM, To his credit, he and his staff made great efforts to placate me, and to redeem the hotel. The GM, Harold Yung, wanted to meet me to explain the situation personally--though my schedule didn't allow that. Their Duty Manager Paul went out of his way to make me feel comfortable and happy, notwithstanding the lack of the lounge. He spoke to me a number of times to make sure I was coasting along nicely. Henry who was manning the Priority Counter was also very helpful with my enquiries. Our room attendant, who is from Fujian, China, never failed to smile and chat with us in a friendly manner whenever we bumped into her. What a gem! The hotel did a couple of neat things for my 1-year old grandson: The hotel made a special birthday cake for him, and also arranged for daily baby food to be made for him--besides providing a comfortable crib at no charge. On the day of our departure, Duty manager Paul saw us off in a limousine arranged by the hotel. We recognise the special efforts he made in making us feel valued. Thank you, Paul! For economic reasons, the hotel owners decided to convert the lounge into a restaurant. We can't blame the hotel staff for that. I do appreciate the efforts the hotel's GM and managers devoted to "service recovery." In general the staff were very friendly and helpful. Tip on TIPs: For the bell hop, HK$20 appeared to be appreciated. For the driver who brought us to the airport, I did a HK$60, as he also helped with unloading our luggage. He didn't seem displeased. PLACES OF INTEREST 1. If you are first time in HK, you probably would want to go to all the tourist places--Disneyland, Ocean Park, the Peak, the Big Buddha. Having been to HK a number of times, we chose untouristy places to visit. LLAMMA island was great for strolling and hiking. Quaint little place, no cars. Good food, which wasn't expensive. There is a solitary modern windmill on the mountian, up there somewhere, after you have trudged uphill for about 25 minutes. Just one of those white wind turbines you see from time to time on TV. From high you can also get a panoramic view of parts of Hong Kong. What's special about this island is that it's such a serene place within a metropolis. To get to Llamma Island: From Causeway Bay MTR, go the Central Station, cross over to Pier Number 4, get a ferry to Yuen Shue Wan, which is on Llamma island--the fare is about HK$16--for a 30 minutes' ride. Visiting HONG KONG UNIVERSITY was educational. It is unlike other universities I have visited. The university buildings are literally dispersed over the slope of a mountain. The buildings are not pretty; they look like office buildings, some rather old too. The cafeteria is modern and serves international and local cuisines. As a non student, you can only grab a cup of coffee there. I would say this university has some character. Our family took a cab from Central MTR station to the university entrance, HK$27. On the way back to the hotel, we took a minibus...and got off at Causeway Bay. You probably should speak Cantonese if you want to do the minibus. My family also spent some time in HONG KONG PARK. You can get there via Pacific Place, a huge modern shopping mall accessible from the Admiralty MTR station. The park is small, but it's unique as you can see all the spanking new skyscrapers hovering behind the flowers and trees of the park. There's an aviary which has a large variety of birds flying around, doing things birds do (like, in our imagination, threatening to spread bird flu), within a enclosed space. There is also a small exhibition space for Chinese stone seals. I like the park, with locals and foreigners strolling around, looking at the floral and fauna, because it gives me a feel of the real HK . It's not touristy. Free entrance to the park and its facilities. JOCKEY CLUB. The Club, with its wide green field and tracks, is just 10 minutes by foot from the hotel. I consider it one of the best things about Crowne Plaza. You can do your exercise in a nice open and green space, and soak in the old and new atmosphere of HK created by the surrounding old and new buildings. Forget about the nice gym in the hotel, and go down the race course! All manner of people are jogging, walking and playing football there. LOCAl OPEN MARKET. If you have never been to one, you must do so. If you have been to one, you will, like me, want to go again. There's one near the hotel, along Hennessy road; ask the hotel staff and they will tell you. It's about 12-minute walk from the hotel. You will find fish, still alive and jumping, being sold by the road. Not exactly kind, but rather picturesque. Stalls are selling fruit, vegetables, dried food stuff, fish, chicken....whatever can be eaten the Chinese way. Noise level--hundreds of decibels. If you have any questions, do email me, and I'll see if I can answer them. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience - missed the club lounge”
Reviews.Author: AndygWatford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at he Crowne Plaza in Causweay Bay during a business trip to HK last week. The location is really good, just near Times Square shopping mall and adjacent to Happy Valley race course. The welcome and the attitude of the staff was first class as was the quality of the food and ambience at the bar. The internet facilities were reasonable, the rooms stylish and the beds really comfortable. All in all a very good base either for business or pleasure when visiting Hong King. I would however echo another reviewer in lamenting the lack of a club lounge. As a business traveller, I very much appreciate the opportunity to get out of my room to do some work in the relatively quiet and calm surroundings a club lounge offers in many IC group hotels around the world. The proposed alternative i.e. the bar on the top floor was too public for this purpose. So for this fact only ill give 4 stars rather than 5 - if they can fix this before my next visit Ill consider upgrading! I have to say however the happy hour at the bar is really good and the buffet breakfast and dinner in the restaurant is excellent, fresh, varied and tasty. Will definitely stay on my next trip to HK, if they fix the lounge, I may even bring some of my colleagues too !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room design, great views, good location, very nice staff and high service levels: my favorite HKG hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RaffaelloSingapore
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay is officially my favorite hotel in Hong Kong: for a relatively reasonable price this very centrally located property offers top notch service by always friendly staff, and a quite ingenious room experience on top of it all. I stayed in a king bed room with a view of the Happy Valley racecourse, which was fabulous: Hong Kong is such a 'concrete city', it really does make a difference to be able to look outside your hotel room window, and see some greenery (especially with blue skies and sunshine). The room itself was quite spacious, and extremely well designed: besides a very comfortable bed, well laid out closets and storage space and a big bathroom with a 'rainforest' shower, there were some extras which do give this hotel quite an edge over the competition. The first thing to mention is the fantastic in room entertainment system, which offers a big flat screen TV, in room DVD player and a superior sound system built into the ceiling of the room. The sound system is even installed in the bathroom, and due to a clever design feature (sliding door between bedroom and bathroom shower cubicle) one can take a shower and still watch TV at the same time. Even though this is not really a "necessity", it sure does add a huge amount of "cool" to the room experience. Did I mention that the sound quality is first rate, and the choice of channels and pay-per-view movies is extensive? The second great feature of the room is the room layout and also the quality of the furniture itself: these days, so many modern and/or newly built hotels do fall completely short in this department. Not so the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay: whether it is the cleverly placed working desk, the bathroom and bedroom layout, the vast storage area (including an easily accessible safe) or the well stocked and organized mini bar, as well as the ample storage space for suitcases; this hotel room does offer great functionality as well as a welcoming, warm ambience in true 'urban chique' style. The materials used within the room were all of very high quality, and this can also be said of the service level provided. During my entire stay, I only encountered friendly staff and had very positive experiences with all the services ordered. From in-room dining (I never waited more than 20 minutes for an order) to laundry service and all the way to the general room service: everything was top notch. I did encounter some problems with other hotel guests calling my room at odd times, and charges of these calls miraculously showing up on my hotel bill. But the charges were immediately taken off my bill once I informed the check out staff that I had not used the phone - no questions asked. I also took breakfast on two days in the restaurant on the first floor: the selection of items offered was extensive (Western and Asian staples were offered), the service friendly and attentive, and the restaurant experience was overall enjoyable (even though, it does not come at a cheap price). The Crowne Plaze Causeway Bay is just a short walk away from Times Square and the World Trade Center building. There are tons of good restaurants close to the hotel, and the shopping district surrounding the hotel does offer endless choices for any shopper's taste and budget. The hotel offers a well equipped gym as well as a roof top swimming pool and bar with great views over the city. Connectivity within Hong Kong is superb - due to the subway being very close by as well as numerous bus and tram lines right in front of the hotel. I took the Airport Express to and from Hong Kong Station, and from there one can simply take a taxi to the hotel or use the subway. Everything in Central, Wanchai and Causeway Bay is easily reachable within minutes, and even trips to Kowloon are easily manageable. All in all, the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay is a fabulous hotel offering high quality service. It is easily accessible and centrally located, and offers great service and amenities - whether you are a business traveler or on holidays. The Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay delivers a true luxury hotel experience, which I am very much looking forward to for my next visit to Hong Kong and this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: roralism
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but not happy with room service , ordered a sirloin steak sandwich on the Wednesday night and it was great then on the Saturday night after a tiring day I ordered the same thing and was delivered a rotten leftover roast beef sandwich (not steak ) We just felt cheated and won't stay again

Reviews.Title: “Just right.”
Reviews.Author: miyuki27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a convenient locations just steps from Times Square in Causeway Bay. It is however, a bit of a walk from the MTR entrance to the actual trains themselves. The room was a nice size, clean and the bathroom shower open to the room with a sliding wall for privacy was a nice touch. The staff were decent though we were pretty self sufficient so there wasn't much interaction with the staff. Nonetheless, we very much enjoyed our stay. Perhaps next time we'll have time to enjoy their amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Causeway Bay - Hong Kong / Better to stay in Admiralty”
Reviews.Author: mrittmayer
Reviews.Content: When in Hong Kong I usually stay in the JW Marriott in Pacific Place. I tried the Crowne Plaza for the same price. What a mistake, quality of service lower, room value lower, location value lower, just about every thing was of lesser value. Never again at the crowne plaza....Just stay at JW Marriott and enjoy the club lounge and the pool and everything else..... JW Same price 1000% more value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Suite in the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Denise C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite at this hotel. The design make you feel like home. Very spacious, clean and modern living room and bathroom. The bedroom overlook the Happy Valley Racecourse. the bed is big and comfy. Shampoo and soap by Hermes', the luxury brand. The service was great. Complimentary buffet breakfast and complimentary evening cocktails and snacks at club 28 on the rooftop beside the swimming pool. Skyline look amazing! Remember to check out the Pavilion one floor lower than the swimming pool. Location is perfect. It is just a few minutes walk to Times Square. Lots of restaurants in the area. I would like to stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggieMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. Front Desk prepared for coming and going. Rooms as promised. Very comfortable, beautiful view of HappyValley and surrounding hills. Liked the pool-- what a view. Great locationnear beautiful Times Square Mall, MTR subway. Will stay here again when I have the points, otherwise it is above my budget.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, could be excellent but no longer has club facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, it has all the facilities which one would expect of the modern, trendier, Crowne Plaza brand; the rooms, some of which have a view over the Happy Valley racecourse and the HK Football Club, are of good size and are well fitted. Bathrooms are of the latest ‘glass wall’ design and although not overly generous, the size is adequate and the showers super, hot and powerful. The working facilities in the rooms are excellent, with Wi-Fi included in the price of a ‘club’ room, an iPhone/iPod docking and charging station and a mobile phone is provided for guest use, although I can’t imagine that anyone uses this facility, as everyone I know, carries their own. The beds are Crown Plaza standard and to my mind, the most comfortable anywhere, the lighting is quirky! This was my fourth stay at this hotel and although I keep returning, whenever I have business in Hong Kong, I feel that I should share my only complaint, which is, the complete lack of club facilities, despite the fact that they still charge for them. There are no club rooms and a new category has been added to the CP norm which is described as a “Privilege Room” but this, as far as I can tell is no different to any other. I was offered an up-grade to a room with a view but as I had booked the most expensive option available, other than a suite and I am a Platinum member, I couldn’t understand how I could be up-graded. I asked to see the two rooms, to compare the difference but suddenly the language barrier dropped and I decided not to pursue the matter further. As the club lounge in this hotel has been converted into a Chinese restaurant; although, I can hardly believe that HK needs yet another Chinese restaurant, the private breakfast and drinks facilities no longer exist. The club floor ‘happy hour’, which is a great Crowne Plaza plus, no longer exists either. One can enjoy drinks during ‘happy hour’ but in the public bar, next to the swimming pool on the roof, I tried this and was told that I could occupy my table for only twenty minutes, as it was booked. Business travellers need a separate facility, where the screams of swimmers and canto-pop music, do not drown their conversation and they do not need to book tables. Intercontinental Hotels, please give us back our Crowne Plaza club facilities, or clearly state on your Website booking pages, which of your hotels do not provide these facilities. If you do not provide the normal CP Club Facilities, which is the main reason why business travellers use your hotels, you should not advertise them on your Website or indeed, charge for them. Business travellers do not wish to trawl through the small print every time we book a hotel; if it says ‘club’ then it should mean ‘club’ and the facilities provided should be standard. This is a good hotel, it could be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed at this hotel 1st time”
Reviews.Author: click11
Reviews.Content: Just loved everything about this hotel- other than the foyer. Checking was quick and efficient. Foyer is nothing more than a few comfy seats and 3 lifts. But once you get out of the foyer- the hotel room floors are luxurious and clean. The rooms wonderful, plenty of room not at all small. The bathroom was fantastic, we had the disabled room (in other words no bath) but it made up for it with an amazing extra large shower that we loved!! I just loved the pool area and enjoyed the happy hour one evening- amazing views (on the 28th floor). On the 27th floor they have this outdoor seating area wich in the morning is just amazing- views and sunshime and quietness- we spent 2 hours there one morning just enjoying the atmosphere. The hotels locations was just 3 mins walk to Times square and all the amazing shops surrounding the area. The shops on this side are open till 11pm and later for some. I just loved this hotel- staff, location, room, views. I just can't comment on the breakfast as we enjoy going out and trying all the local places- which we did, and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel,one I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Leatherbuyer
Reviews.Content: Rooms good,staff first class.Top floor bar excellent. My hotel when I am in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: yachty78
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here, but what a hotel. The 27 floor pool bar and restaraunt was amazing. I think its the best style hotel bar I have ever been in. The staff were great and room wonderful, with a fantastic view out the window.

Reviews.Title: “Meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: JGS360
Reviews.Content: A good, modern hotel in the heart of the Causeway Bay shopping district. The rooms were as comfortable as you would expect, with a decent size bathroom. No problem with the check in efficiency and they handled my stay extension without fuss. Overall, rooms and service were good. There are two issues I have with this hotel. The first is that internet access is not included. For the price it really should be. Management, if you want to annoy your guests, charging 120HKD for internet access does the trick. Second is the poor TV channel selection. One English movie channel, limited news channels, no English TV series channels. This really surprised me. If you don't need internet, and don't want to watch any TV, this hotel is really good, and decent price compared to the other high end options in on HK Island.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Irvine92606
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located close to Causeway Bay MTR, which is located in Times Square shopping mall. It's about 5-minute walk from the hotel. Hong Kong MTR is very easy to navigate. I have no sense of directions and get lost very easily and I didn't have a problem finding my destinations in Hong Kong. Everything is extremely clearly marked! I went everywhere using the public transportation system (mainly MTR, also bus, small bus, tram, cable car, boat). Did not find it necessary to take a cab once. Getting to the hotel from the airport is easy. I used the hotel shuttle and got dropped off in front of the lobby. I prebooked the return trip and the bus showed up on time. Round-trip fare was 240HKG (140 for one way trip). As a platinum member, I got upgraded to a big room on the 14th floor overlooking Happy Valley Racecourse. The room is modern and well appointed with a huge flat screen TV and ipod docking station. Bed was super comfy. The bathroom has bath and rainshower. The layout is simply fantastic! A Nokia mobile phone is provided. I had my own cell phone so didn't use it but it is a nice perk. Service is efficient and friendly. A welcome plate of fruits for the 1st night. Two complimentary bottles of water everyday. Wi-fi and wired internet free. There are plenty of eateries around the hotel. If you turn right immediately, less than 50 meters there is a Chinese restaurant offering "morning dim sum special" 38HKG for 10 dim sum items. I tried it once and the food was great. In the basement of Times Square there are so many restaurant choices and the food selections are excellent! There are also grocery and convenience stores close by. The hotel is obviously well run. Everything works great. I'm a picky traveller and I can't find any fault here :-) Excellent value and I would stay there again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickBaby8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used points to stay 3 nights here recently. Good location, only a couple blocks away from the Times Square Causeway Bay MTR station. Room was a decent size, clean with decent amenities. They provided us with a cell phone, not sure if it was free or not as we had already purchased a sim card at the airport, but we popped in our sim card and used the phone during our trip. There was fruit plate waiting for us, as well as complimentary mineral water. Hailing a cab from the hotel (which we only did once) is a bit of a hassle because of the way the road is facing, the cab had go all the way around the racetrack (the hotel is right next to the Happy Valley horse racetrack) so that obviously added fare and time to our ride. Generally used the MTR which was much easier. As with the locations of many other HK hotels, lots of stores and local restaurants close by. We also found a laundry-mate a few blocks away where we could drop off laundry then pick it up later, which was great and cheape than doing it with the hotel. Went up to their rooftop bar a couple times, nice views and decent service. There is free wifi in the bar so if you do not have the package which includes free wifi, its worth it to go the lounge, order yourself a drink and use the wifi there. All in all, no complaints. Staff were friendly, curteous and helpful, room was nice and location convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Modern w/ views”
Reviews.Author: pinayflashpacker
Reviews.Content: New, modern hotel w/ smallish rooms typical of HK. Very comfy bed w/ views over a playing field, sports club and mountains. Bathroom was fantastic with bath and rainshower. It was close to Times Square (MTR) and Causeway beyond but with a baby (on stroller), it was tad difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Return Stay didn't Meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ri_Sun8
Reviews.Content: This is my return visit to the hotel, as a PC Platinum the first stay exceed expectations but not the second stay. My room was not upgraded, was also given the lousy city view; when I requested for the racecourse view, was told to pay extra... Only benefit was free Internet, disappointing treatment for a platinum... Was so rudely turned away at top floor bar...

Reviews.Title: “"Crowne Plaza HK...Excellent"”
Reviews.Author: Babubear
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza (CP) is located in Causeway Bay, Hong Kong, 50 mins from airport by taxi. Some may say this is far from city however, with MTR which is only 5 mins walk you can't beat its location. I have stayed at Intercontinental which is part of IHG group although with its breath-taking views from hotel rooms and service, CP beats that with local eateries located close proximity to the hotel and you have all the top-labels stores in the one area..for all shoppers that is soo cool... For business travellers this hotel would be ideal as is located close to financial business district. CP is still new, hotel rooms are well designed and service is excellent. CP is known for its 'business' hotel and corporate guests would agree its work desk is well designed with more work space in mind. Room has all modern amenities ie ipod charger, flat tv, turn down service etc.This is definitely my first choice when visiting Hong Kong. Looking forward to my next stay at CP!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: lenusvyat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just excellent all around. Good location, excellent service, great views, etc

Reviews.Title: “Great business or leisure hotel with some nice perks but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Bluenose_Sydney
Reviews.Content: My wife accompanied me on a recent four day business trip to HK and we loved this hotel. We opted for the executive room which was huge and very luxurious. Nice features like a decent ipod connector and 42" flat screen. Great desk which is usually one of my gripes in so called "business" hotels. Nice touches like the maid noticed I didn't have a mouse pad and left one for me to use without needing to be asked. Good high speed internet and wireless. Bar and pool on the top floor were very nice and a great way to get out of the stifling heat of the city in summer and cool off the feet. Unfortunately the service in the bar was atrocious - needed to seek out the bar staff and the selection of beers/wine was not great but these are small things. Bar on the level below the pool is spectacular. Great breakfast. My new favorite business hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel in the middle of city”
Reviews.Author: Handy K
Reviews.Content: Returned to Hong Kong again after 15 years, A LOT have changed. Went with my family (5 adults and a 4 year old) decided to look for new hotels that we haven't heard before, so Trip Advisor to the rescue. Found Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay and it was the choice: Pro: Location right in the middle of Causeway Bay and near to shopping centers and public transport (MTR 5 minute walk, Tram stop right in front of the hotel) The hotel felt new and it is new. Efficient lobby, room level 1-25. Stayed in level 23. Ask for Happy Valley view NOT the city view. Room was sufficient for 3 adults max. As we enter the room, we felt this hotel is suitable for business purposes. One amazing feature is that the hotel provided us with the use of a Nokia mobile phone for free. It acts as a room telephone but in the shape of mobile phone. It's very useful and practical for visitors. Breakfast was excellent. The menu selection wasn't wide but the taste and quality is what you expect from Crowne Plaza. The swimming pool is at the top floor, views are breathtaking, you can see the surrounding Causeway Bay and the stunning view of Happy Valley. Try jogging at the Happy Valley recreational ground to get a figure of Hong Kong community and the vastness of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Probably more suited for leisure rather than business trips”
Reviews.Author: High_J
Reviews.Content: Situated near the Hong Kong Time Square shopping belt, the location of the hotel is good for travelers on vacation and enjoy shopping. Nearest MTR is Causeway Bay station via the Time Sq exit. The hotel is stil less than a year old and as such the interior and furnishing are still new and pleasant. Definitely stay in the rooms facing Happy Valley which opens up to a view that offers "space". Otherwise, you'd be stuck with the room view that faces a next block at a close distance, especially if you are assigned to rooms towards the end nearer the left hand side (assuming you are facing the hotel block). The pool which opens up to a nice view is actually quite small to enable an invigorating workout. Service-wise, still a littled jagged and nowhere near standards of established chains such as JW Marriott, Shangri-la and boutiques like Lanson Place. The reason I mentioned that this is not that suited for business travellers is because of the location of the hotel. The cab stand at the lobby is situated at the end of Leighton Road. To travel by cab from the hotel to Central (if your office is located there), the cab must travel up further to Happy Valley first before looping back down to Causeway Bay, where you'd be stuck a little in peak hour traffic. Also, from 830am to 9 plus in the morning, getting a cab can be a long wait. I waited for 20min and gave up to walk up a few blocks to hail a cab myself. If you are staying here and wish to travel by cab, allow for ample time to travel to Central or Airport Express Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - ideal location and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Dubai123_11
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I spent 4 nights at this hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is well located near Times Square and the MTR. They upgraded our room when we took the additional breakfast package, so we had great views from the 26th floor. Our room was well appointed and the bathroom lovely and modern. We enjoyed our cocktails in the rooftop bar and our time at the poolside. The concierge staff were outstanding - particularly Tony and Kenneth who gave us excellent advice, directions and made bookings for us. The level of service from all the staff was outstanding. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Infinity00
Reviews.Content: Checking In- I requested for a high floor and they gave me one of the lowest levels and was told that this is all I get for rooms in my price category- in effect telling me that S$300 per room per night would make us the lowest category of customers for this hotel. Not a good start. If i wanted rooms any higher, I would have to pay quite a big sum for breakfast which worked out to about an additional HK$500-600 per room which was not worth the breakfast. Location- Actually not ideal as the main areas tourists go to in HK are along the red line i.e. Central, Tsim Sha Tsui and Mongkok while Causeway Bay is on the blue line, which would entail a transfer to virtually everywhere you go. Also, the walk from the Causeway Bay MTR station to the nearest exit to the hotel entails an extremely long walk. Elderly folks should note this. view from room- View is average if you get rooms facing Happy Valley (from my low level), but if you get rooms facing Leighton Road, all you see out of the window are buildings just metres away. Absolutely not worth the money. Furnishing- The furnishing in the rooms were new and relatively plush. Bathrooms were decent sized with a glass wall separating the shower area from the room. Pool- was very small and situated right beside the hotel bar. Seems like an afterthought. Overall review- There are better hotels out there in better locations with comparable prices. Go get yourself another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for good value”
Reviews.Author: Relakjack
Reviews.Content: Biggest thing in its favour is that its brand new, so everything is well kept. Rooms are large by HK standards, and well thought out. Especially useful is the multi-charger in the room for every manner of mobile device you could possible pack. The bed was wonderful, though. Otherwise, pretty much excellent service as I've come to expect of a Inter-Continental Group hotel. Location wise, not too bad, easy walk to Causeway Bay MTR at Times Square; alternatively easy to hop on a tram to Central and back. However taking a cab can be quite a challenge at peak hour, but the bellboys are great at hunting down cabs, if you're prepared to wait a little. Not so good for tourists if you''re heading up to Jordan, which requires a change at Admiralty. Rooftop pool looks nice in the pictures, but be warned that it is right outside the bar and watering hole, so if you don't mind being part of the scenery, that's fine. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: SeeingIsBelieving007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe room and will absolutely stay here again. The Crowne Plaza is quite new, it only opened in the last year or two. Location is excellent, close to Times Square, Causeway Bay shops restauarants and MTR, etc. Also very close to Happy Valley racecourse. Service was helpful and friendly, no mesing around. The room was great, one of the biggest I have seen for this price range in Hong Kong. Large comfortable bed, very clean, iphone dock, and a huge bathroom with separate shower and bath. This is a god hotel for either business or leisure. Only thing I disliked was they charge extra for wifi/internet - ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: lsulli
Reviews.Content: I stay in HK pretty regularly for work and was delighted to be put in the Crowne Plaza in Causway Bay as I had watched it being built. In a city famed for tiny hotel rooms, the Crowne Plaza's rooms are comfortably roomy, beautifully finished and amazingly well equipped. On top of that the service was really good. Would very much recommend it. My only criticism is that it is next to impossible to get a decent deal which makes is very expensive (come on Accor!).

Reviews.Title: “Bravo! At last! A city/business hotel that doesn't over sell itself and under-deliver and has totally thought about the customer”
Reviews.Author: adlynmeg
Reviews.Content: 1. Plenty of power sockets and neat and easy to find! How many hotels have too few power sockets that are hard to find or are messy adapters?! This has them neatly presented as well as all the other sockets a business traveller needs. 2. Apple dock through the telly! Not many 5 or 6 * hotels have this. A business traveller always has his iPod and this is a GREAT touch! Very nice TV set up. 3. Good gym. Overlooking the hills and Happy Valley. Good new machines with iPod connectors and uploadable.Brilliant! The gym is light and airy and up high floor with full length windows overlooking Happy. 4. A little pocket map in the shoe cupboard to show a jogging route! Nice touch and attention to detail. 5. Full bathroom kit (toothbrushes etc). Maybe pretty standard these days but they top up everything everyday and it is neatly presented. 6. Fresh fruit in your room. In fact everything about this hotel is clean, neat, sharp, functional. The rooms are bright, modern and clean. Nice bathroom layout. Excellent breakfast buffet. Rapid check-in/check-out. I am usually very under whelmed by hotels over stating themselves and under delivering. This place does the opposite. I have stayed in most of the hotels in this area and this is the best by a mile. If it wasn't so popular I would only ever stay here on my HK business. BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: gordykathom
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel! Club floor if you can. Extras are grand, pool on top floor is worth the cost of the room. Breakfast was a delight. Staff very helpful, fast elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Juanus
Reviews.Content: Good business trip hotel, close to MTR. Nice spacious, clean rooms. Good buffet for breakfast. It's less a holiday hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent service”
Reviews.Author: Sharon Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped by HK for a week after our honeymoon, and we stayed at the Crowne Plaza for about 5 days. It's at a decent location close to times square where a few good restaurants and shops are, and it's close to the MTR. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious. Knowing that we are honeymooners they even gave us a bottle of bubbly to celebrate which was nice. Too bad they don't offer free internet as it would've been a much greater hotel experience for us that way.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific modern hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: eaststar
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at The Four Seasons when I visit HK but had to be in the Causeway Bay area on this trip so chose the Crowne Plaza. I'm so glad I did because this hotel is a wonderful find, and in some ways, it beats even the much more expensive 5-star properties. The hotel is pretty new and it shows, but on top of the newness, the rooms are also very well-laid out and spacious. The bathrooms are also large, with both shower and tub, a generous sized sink and counter-top and an amenities drawer with a plugged-in hair dryer easily at hand (as opposed to some hotels where the hair dryers are kept outside the bathroom or need to be plugged in each time). The shower heads are smooth and easy to operate so you can set the water temperature to your precise liking without having to fight with tight faucets or weak water pressure). I especially loved the bed and pillows, which were so comfortable that I slept really well despite being a lifelong tosser and turner. They offered two pillow types -- a soft one and a firmer one, and the firmer one was fantastic, offering great support without being uncomfortable or too high. In fact I'm contacting the hotel to see if I can buy the pillow for my home use. It's that good. My room came with breakfast and this was offered every morning in a lavish buffet spread, with cooked-to-order eggs, pancakes, fruit, cereal, Chinese congee (porridge) and all the trimmings, and much more. Service throughout the hotel was efficient, warm and friendly. The hotel's location is also a winner -- it's a 5 minute walk to the Times Square/Sogo shopping area, with plenty of shops, cafes, restaurants and office buildings all around.

Reviews.Title: “very nice standard hotel, good service, very good value”
Reviews.Author: peterr67
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many times in HK. For this location it is not possible to find a better standard of hotel at anything like this price. It is located in the centre of where you would want to be as a visitor or tourist - shops, restaurants, site seeing. The rooms are large (in fact very large compared to what you normally get in HK for this price) and very nicely done. The hotel is new and clean. Service is wonderful. Did not eat in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Excellent Hotel - Several Small Annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Distantlightning
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent ten days at the Crown Plaza Causeway Bay. I would rank the hotel property and location a 9.5 out of 10. We had a King Deluxe Room on the 17th Floor overlooking Times Square. Some people have complained about the views on this side of the hotel. But, it's a city of tall buildings and the building has four sides. There is not much they can do to offer views all around. Ours wasn't bad. The hotel is 27 floors, I think. Higher floors definitely have better views, as well as do suites and club rooms overlooking the very beautiful Hidden Valley Race Course and mountains beyond. So, if you want a view from the big floor to ceiling windows in your room take these things into consideration when booking or checking in. The location was just about perfect for us. We like to explore on foot. The bus picks up in front of the hotel. Taxis pass every few seconds. Times Square, with it's City Market (grocery store and deli), plethora of dining destinations, MRT Station, etc. is just a little over a block away. There are also several nice Noodle Shops, a Tea Station and a 7-11 across the street. It is a very short walk to the Causeway Bay shopping area. There are several nice markets nearby which are well lighted and open at night, including a woman's market. Victoria Park is also within easy walking distance. So, in short, for the kind of things we like to do, namely exploring the area on foot, it's a perfect location. The room was very nice. The bed was really comfortable. The hotel was very quiet. The shower and bathroom was very nice. The maid service was excellent. The hotel employees were very nice and helpful. There are several small things. I would agree with reviews that say the pool is very nice, but lacks privacy, especially at night. The night club is right beside it, and has a big glass wall overlooking the pool. At night you do feel a bit like you are in a fish bowl. During the day, the club is largely empty. So, this is the time to use it unless you like being seen and likely the topic of conversation in swimming attire by fully clothed people. I know it is a common practice in Asia to charge for internet. But, from a U.S. perspective internet access in a nice hotel is a right of passage. The internet at the hotel will cost you HK$200, per device, per day, wired or wireless. You have to ascent to their terms and conditions and renew this every day. They did comp ours as a Platinum Level perk. But, be aware of this significant potential cost. Hong Kong has several widespread wireless internet providers which are much cheaper. You can subscribe online on the Airport Express train to save some money if you need internet,. and it will work all over the city in many places. This is very convenient if you are using an Android, Blackberry or iPhone with WiFi to check email, etc. in lieu of very high cellular data roaming rates. We stayed in the hotel using reward nights. My travel agent, not paying proper attention to the time difference had us checking out one day earlier than our return flight. The hotel management would not allow us to book another reward night, but required payment of the regular room rate via credit card, claiming that all of their reward night rooms were taken. The hotel clearly makes more money when they host cash customers, instead of accepting credits from the rewards program. But, considering we had spent ten days in the hotel, I really considered this petty and cheap and was quite annoyed. This was discretionary on the part of the hotel. I think they should have allowed us to book a further reward night to cover this obvious mistake in the initial reservation. All in all I would say it was an excellent hotel. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: jetsettel
Reviews.Content: Came here for a meeting from bangkok, and arrived at 7.25pm. At check in, I was offered a "package upgrade", which to be honest I didn't understand, but assumed (wrongly) that it was aprt of my Platinum member package. Upgrade was cocktails and canapes until 7.30, free interent, and breakfast. By the time I got to my room, cocktails and canapes had finished, the internet was apalling, with lost (wired) connections al the time, and breakfast was only just average. I paid around HK$400 for one night, and have to say I was less than impressed. I challenged the up-sell, and the hotel kindly agreed to refund me the HK$385 that they charged me, so a big up for them for doing that, they were under no legal obligation to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautful hotel and Great service”
Reviews.Author: nnouhi
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, in a great location with excellent service. The hotel size is perfect, not too big and not too small. The rooms are also a good size, definitely comfortable and not cramped. The decor is modern and understated. The rooftop pool, though not large, is nice with a bar and great views of Hong Kong. Prior to arrival, I asked for connecting rooms, since we have two children, and sure enough, we were given appropriate rooms immediately. We travel frequently and making sure that we have attached rooms is always a hassle. Most places don't accomodate us until a night or two into our stay, which then requires packing and moving. Overall, we loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was not expecting a lot .. but pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: bgibbs_travels
Reviews.Content: great hotel in a terrific location. the rooms were well appointed. gym was pretty good. my only disappointment was the friendliness of staff and the food offering was pretty average (all passable but could do a lot to improve and make this hotel excellent) ... but the location and rooms could bring me back again for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Service, Awesome Location...loved it.”
Reviews.Author: mcmug2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for one week while traveling to HK to visit family. We were traveling with an active 1.5 yr old so we wanted to make sure the hotel room was reasonably sized and the hotel had a pool....this hotel did not disappoint. Room was extremely spacious by Asian cities standard, with shower stall + full size bath tub...and we'd a great view of the Happy Valley Race course. The hotel is just right behind Times Square/Leighton Center, so about 5mins walk from subway station and all the main shopping area. There are many restaurants near by so absolutely no need to eat at the hotel. As a platinum member we also got free in-room wi-fi access. The outdoor pool was extremely nice as well...a bit cold in Nov as it was on the roof top but great place for a swim. Absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good location for getting around”
Reviews.Author: Dog_Spheroids
Reviews.Content: Not been to Far East for some time ... and on this business trip had 3 countries to do. Hong Kong was first stop off .... been some years since I was last there ... and it hasn’t changed. Trip in on the fast train from new airport was fast, clean very efficient ... followed by short taxi ride to Hotel ... taxis are so cheap in HK. The Hotel is a bit strange in that it looks nothing really from outside, almost drab compared to the new glass tower blocks everywhere (more skyscrapers in HK than in NYC) However don’t be disappointed – after a somewhat small reception area, and being checked in by typical HK efficiency .... you get to your room .... and what a room. One wall floor to ceiling glass window .. massive flat screen TV with surround sound, and a iPad dock. Desk has all working needs including free WiFi and charging points for all types of phones & Laptops ... AC plugs in HK are same as UK. There is a nice roof top pool along side the bar .. unfortunately we arrived in Chinese New Year ,... and it had shut for annual maintenance. The bar has great views over HK and you sit outside on roof top balcony, great in evening breeze. I used the gym each day which is at top of Hotel and looks out over the stunning vista of the Lower levels and the Honk Kong racecourse .. I only ate breakfast at hotel ... and what a breakfast ... everything Western you could think of, cereals, breads, croissants, pancakes, eggs, bacon etc,. ... all omelettes, eggs cooked fresh while you wait ... nothing ‘keeping warm’ here. Plus a hundred things Asian .. most of which I had no idea what they were cooking  We were in Causeway Bay ... which means one block away is Time Square and the biggest shopping Mall around ... all you could want to buy, plus 2 floors of just restaurants ... any cuisine you could want. However get out and about in the side streets to find real places to eat ... noisy, chaotic, but great value and fun. Recommend going to Soho ... loads of choice restaurants, and great prices. If you have the time take the cable car to Lan Tao island, and the monastery and see the worlds biggest bronze Buddha sitting on top of the mountain .... so different to noise of HK. They have just opened a Disney Land ... but kept well away from that. For a night out get the tram from central up to the Peak (don’t eat there) grab a beer, watch the sun go down and the light show come on ......... breath taking. If you want to do a real touristy thing get to Aberdeen harbour and take in a meal at the Floating Jumbo Restaurant .... if you choose a banquet ... you will get course after course of things that you won’t recognise and would never choose .. but colours and tastes are amazing. You don’t have to choose your own lobster & grouper form the tanks when invited to – but it’s all part of the experience. It even starts with a red carpet and boat ride out to be greeted by guards in Imperial dress. The markets are everywhere .. and everything you could want is on sale ........ and I mean everything. Watch what you buy ... as one vendor hawked a Rolex to me for price of a Timex ... “Not fake meester, Genuine copy” East meets West for sure .... you stand outside one of the best Hotels in the world, and then walk past a guy strangling a chicken to cook on his hand cart ... Hong Kong is a spectacle.

Reviews.Title: “Great, simple hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: awaywardtraveller
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay one cannot really fault this hotel. Rooms are large and comfy, service is exceptional and the bar is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great city”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxbound
Reviews.Content: Not near the water which is a big thing for hotels here, but this is a good hotel. Staff bends over backwards, English is spoken, and they were very helpful. Had the breakfast, it's expensive ($35), but anything you'd want is there. Top floor bar has great views of the city. All modern, good size room, and easy to get around from the hotel. 5 minute walk to the subway, and the subways in HKG are cheap and easy to use. Right near Times Square, but most of HKG is similar, so no big deal there. HKG is a very expensive city, but not being on the water means this hotel is a little less expensive than others of the same quality. Biz area is on first floor, and is pretty much worthless. Internet is free depending on your level with Priority Club, but it's $20 per day otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ana_London_79
Reviews.Content: Although a bit out from main attractions, the hotel was really nice and staff extremely friendly and helpful. Really easy to get on the underground - taxi can be tricky as they have to go all the way round Happy Valley, but still would not be a rip off to get one to the other side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel - Easy access to MTR”
Reviews.Author: jmblaze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 2 hotels in HK this week... I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott and This Crowne Plaza... Both of them are incredible. As for the CP, the rooms were amazing and quite a bit larger than I expected. Very comfortable room with easy to access switches for lights and such. The bathroom was also incredible! Very friendly staff, Awesome pool... I really Cannot give this hotel enough +'s! Highly Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 night stay with a 2 yr old ... miss it already”
Reviews.Author: cr8zymike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with our 2 yr old in a deluxe room. It was very spacious for a HK hotel with a great bathroom. The glass shower enclosure had a rainfall shower head with a great amount of pressure. I personally hate going to hotels and find weak water pressure. I could have stayed in the shower forever. The room has a flat screen tv and room surround system .... and guess what ... the room was literally sound proof! We couldn't hear our neighbours, doors closing in the halls or any traffic at all. The hotel is in a great location for us with Times Sqaure, choice of lots of food (congee for 8HKD and lotus rice for 8HKD for breakfast), outdoor market, laundry (50HKD for a big sack) and the subway station close by. All of this was important for us because it was already really hot in HK and we came back in the afternoon to let our little one sleep and to take a shower and be refreshed for the late-evening trek. Staff was great and very friendly. We enjoyed our stay here and will definitey stay here again. I wish that all hotels in this level-category were just like the CP Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel,Wonderfull service”
Reviews.Author: darrenvh
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,could not fault it.The staff couldn't do enough to help.We stopped here for two days on the way to Australia from UK It was a new modern hotel with lovely good sized rooms,large bathroom,with separate large shower,very large TV,and i pod doc,and most importantly a very comfortable large King sized bed. If you are in Hong Kong for any length of time it is well worth getting an OCTOPUS card, you can buy them at the airport when you arrive, or any train station.It will cost you 150 hk dollars and you can use them on any form of transport as we did, MTR,buses,Star ferry,Peak tram,also alot of cafes and food outlets,they can be topped up at stations.When you come to leave Hong Kong just hand in your card at the train station and you will get a refund on what ever you have left ,plus 50 hk dollars the deposit on the card.Don't miss going on the Star Ferry at night time the view is better than Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “I will come back...this time with my family:)”
Reviews.Author: TazMaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel surroundings are good as it is situated near the convention centre and many business people booked this hotel due to its location. It is just 15mins walk to my Hong Kong office building. Check-in went smoothly. My deluxe room is exactly what you see from the hotels website. It was on the 9th floor so not much comments on the views. Since this is my first stay, what surprised me was when I on the TV, the screen reflected some standard greetings but it has my name on it! Its very warmth and personal. The hotel does come with this mobile phone which you may use on your walk about around Hong Kong, which usage will be charged to your room. This is practical if you do not subscribe or simply want to save on the international roaming charges. I had buffet lunch at the restaurant, KUDOS, and found the food of normal standards. Overall hotel staffs service meet expectations but more can be improved for KUDOS staffs. Will definitely come back but with my family instead:)

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, very smart room arrangement”
Reviews.Author: Marc-PhilippeG
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just opened 1 year ago (as of May 2011) Very clean and well maintained so far. Connectivity in rooms has been done extremely well, as well as furniture convenience of use. Excellent beds, linen and pillows. Same for amenities in bathroom, although the quality of products (shampoo for instance) could be improved. Besides, the location is quiet. Not much variety in food, but good. Exceptional for Hong-Kong, staff at reception and at restaurant is even smiling, for a chance (not much, but smiling)

Reviews.Title: “Average Average.....”
Reviews.Author: kumarsamit
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in April 2011. The hotel was just about functional - everything in order but nothing which makes you feel special. The staff was cordial but seemed to be just doing a job rather than going out of the way to make client 'at home'. Food and service too was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for business trip or leisure”
Reviews.Author: glamourbugz
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business trip for 10 days. Love this hotel. I was staying in a Club room on a high floor overlooking Happy Valley with hills in the background. There is a separate check-in desk on the 2nd floor for Club rooms and is on the same level as the snack lounge and business center. Pros: Club rooms comes with free WIFI access in the room and has a snack lounge where you can go anytime for snacks and drinks (including alcoholic drinks) between a certain time. Very nice place to chill and relax with ambient music. Breakfast was included with a great fare of international, Japanese and Dimsum cuisine. Fresh! Club rooms were great and spacious. Very clean. Has an iPod/iPhone docker for charging and playing music. Stationery provided and nice glass table for working and comfortable leather chair Bed was made nice and clean. Love the bathroom with separate bath and shower. Has an auto screen door to close off the shower area from the bedroom. You could actually watch tv while showering if you did not shut the auto screen door. Bathrooms were clean. Taxi stop was just across the Crowne in front of Leighton Centre. Very convenient. Staff are always smiling and very helpful! Con: I found I had to walk out a bit to get some food if I was not eating at the hotel. It is walking distance from Times Square but the food at the Square was bit pricey for my liking. Even if it was not for a business trip, the hotel room would be great for a couple given the free wifi, snack bar and the great service. Would love to go there again

Reviews.Title: “*****worst guest service ever*****”
Reviews.Author: Versailles2011
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night to a luke warm reception, no warm welcome there after a long day of traveling....that's what I want from my hotel. The breakfast staff were very inattentive waited 20mins for coffee and only got it when I had to get up and make a 3rd request to the headwaiter directly, they had one very young man maintaining the hot dishes and cooking the eggs he seemed like he would rather be anywhere but there.....tasteless food. I introduced myself to the concierge who had helped us just to thank him for making our transportation arrangements, he had no time rather he dismissed me. I'm glad I didn't thank him because our english speaking guide was not so english speaking. My aunt had to request clean towels in her room because upon entry to her room she ecountered used towels....disgusting. The staff members are too young...too rude and too uninterested and absolutely no customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: simbloke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and found it to be a very nice hotel. Check-in was quick and easy though it seems their info from booking.com did not show that our rate included breakfast. They took a copy of my booking printout and that was fine. We stayed in their regular room (I forget the name) and it was really nice. Spacious, clean, comfortable bed and a very nice bathroom with a separate shower (that pours from the ceiling). There's a decent sized desk next to power sockets, AV connections for the LCD TV and a USB charger. There was plenty of drawers in the room for storing our bits and pieces. Our room was on the 6th floor so not much of a view but the bar on the top floor can provide that. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Check-out was quick and easy and they happily stored our cases for the rest of the day until we went to the airport. Anything bad? Well the coat-hangers were too wide for my wife's jacket... Also, you need to use your room key-card in the lift, if you're not paying attention someone else will press a button after your card-insertion and you will miss your floor! Really, the rudeness of some folk! Overall I'd say very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious New Hotel Rooms with Excellent Locations”
Reviews.Author: Canberto
Reviews.Content: We knew this was a brand new hotel but we were pleasantly surprised by the spaciousness of the guestrooms. Room furnishing and layout are very modern and well done. With its excellent location, within the heart of Causeway Bay, a shopping heaven and mega selections for restaurants, there is no need to eat in the hotel. The staffs were helpful so do ask before you venture out because Hong Kong streets can be very confusing, with its complex street crossing implemented. The rooftop bar, pool and gym are also recommended, a hidden jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Hong Kong rugby 7's and Happy valley reaces.”
Reviews.Author: Keinton
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 nights at this hotel with a friend and cannot fault it. The greeting at reception was nice and friendly, which is what is needed after travelling for over 17 hours. The room was not the largest on the floor, but still a very good size to some in Hong Kong, and very clean. The view from the bedroom window of the Happy Valley racecourse up on the 2th floor was great. It was only a 5 min walk to the stadium for the 7s, ( we could just see one corner of it from our room). A nice easy walk to Times Square where there was the MTR Causeway Bay station, and just a small distance further was the trams. The transportation in Hong Kong is so easy to use you can get most places easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel with a great location in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: Siera1408
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights last week on a business trip to Hong Kong. Location was great, just less than 5 minute walk from Time Square ( Causeway Bay MTR). The room I stayed in, had a nice view of Happy Valley and wasn't disappointing. It was spacious for Hong Kong standard and broadband internet was included. I didn't have the chance to try the restaurants but the breakfast was just okay, nothing special. Overall, this is a decent business hotel in Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business hotel with a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Prince_A
Reviews.Content: Definitely a business hotel more than a family vacation hotel but if your staying for a short period of time with your family and will be out the whole day sightseeing then it wouldn't really matter anyway.. Lobby was quite small typical of a business hotel but I did like the waterfall effect they had going in the lobby... I couldnt help myself but stare at it while waiting for our bus, very calming presence.. Location was a big plus.. very near Times Square and lots of shops nearby and the MTR.. I was very impressed with the room, was very nice, clean and looked very new or well maintained with a big LCD TV.. Bathroom was very, very clean.. I could'nt find any flaw in it except that when taking a bath, I felt the rainshower wasted a lot of water (zero points in water conservation there).. Food in the hotel were good for sharing which is good especially if your saving your money for your shopping spree.. preparation and taste was also excellent.. we weren't able to try out the swimming pool, i think it was indoor but then again, why spend your time indoors when you have lots of things to do and go to outside..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ms30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza in February for 2 nights. The location is very convenient, with restaurants and cafes just across the street. Bakeries and convenience stores are also near by, which made it easy to go to pick up breakfasts or water. Also, it was only a few short blocks away from the subway station and the Times Square. We were very impressed by the lobby and the room itself. The entire building is very new. The room was very nice, complete with flat screen tv and a plate of fruit to welcome us. The room and especially the washroom were spacious (they were actually bigger than our North American new condo!). Therefore, I feel the room and bathroom were big especially by Hong Kong standards (which tend to be small since Hong Kong is so crowded). The room had a view of tennis courts nearby and the bathroom had a fancy big window which gave great natural light (with the option of blinds for privacy). One other note, I should mention the bed was one of the widest we have ever slept in. It was so comfortable and nice, especially after a 13-hour flight. We loved the service and the staff was very helpful and polite. In summary, we highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are new, the service is great and it is so close to eateries and the subway system. Let me know if this review is helpful....

Reviews.Title: “Decent room”
Reviews.Author: PALMS4EVER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza because it was convenient coming back from Macau. After the spacious and luxurious room in Wynn Macau, it was a bit cramp. However, to be fair, most hotel rooms in Hong Kong are known to be small. It is about 5-7 minutes walk to Times Square and the MTR. However, there isn't much else in the vicinity. The staffs at the reception are efficient and check-in was about 15 minutes. The deluxe rooms are decently furnished with the usual amenities and are comfortable. However you can see dust along the corridor and they were still there when I checked out on the 3rd day. For the value, it would be better staying in some of the more popular hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui. If you are a member of the Crowne Plaza, please note that points are given only for one room even though you are travelling with family. This is not so with my experience with the Starwood and Hyatt groups of hotels. So if I am with my family next time, I will consider other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but forgettable”
Reviews.Author: Back_to_Sandringham
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels which does what it says on the tin, but with no particular character or panache. The location is fine but not great, it is in the middle of a busy intersection and the entrance is not very welcoming. The Club Lounge is nice and the service there is good. We had lunch in the main restaurant and chose the buffet option, and it was decidedly average. In summary, there is nothing wrong with this hotel, but there are a lot of more interesting places to stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGM73
Reviews.Content: I had a great room with a fantastic view of the Hong Kong skyline. The facilities in the room were very good (comfortable bed - clean bathroom). Breakfast was in line with most good hotels with a good range and omlette chefs (always good). The gym was a good place to go with big windows and modern equipment. i would definitely recommend this hotel albeit a bit far from the main business district.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very comfortable and fantastic bathroom”
Reviews.Author: princessbuttercup66
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights for leisure, and were upgraded to a room overlooking the racecourse, (and an eagle's nest, complete with a baby eagle). The room was very comfortable, the bed and pillows fantastic, and loved the beautiful bathroom. We slept very well, and importantly, it's quiet, we didn't hear any noise from other guests, lifts, staff etc. even though the hotel was at capacity occupancy. Buffet breakfast was good quality, we didn't have to wait for a table. Fresh eggs any way you want, is also good. The rooftop pool looked good, but we didn't use it because it was 10 degrees celcius. The hotel is 2 -3 minutes walk from Times Square, and 5 minutes walk to the MTR station. The trams are right outside the hotel. The only things that were not up to scratch were the dinner that we ate in the hotel one night. It was very ordinary, and quite expensive. With so many great places to eat close by, don't bother eating at the hotel, except for breakfast. Also they charge for internet access, and only allow one device to be used. If you want to use a laptop and phone/ipad you need to pay twice! This is very poor, especially considering the price you pay to stay here. Having said that, I think the prices for the quality you get is pretty good value for Hong Kong. One other thing of note is to make sure that you check your bill thoroughly when you check-out. Someone had used our room number to charge drinks, cigarettes and food from the bar on level 28. When we disputed this charge, they made us feel like they didn't believe us. We were told that the credit card holding deposit that you sign when you check-in would be held until it was sorted out. Not happy! They need to have a better system, so that it doesn't make you feel like we were doubted.

Reviews.Title: “Our first room was a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Filo_at_oz
Reviews.Content: First time we have stayed here and our room was a great surprise. On the corner of the building on the 12th floor, amazing room size and a great and functional bathroom. The room was huge, clean and an office / work desk was a bonus ...usually doesn't exist compared to other HK hotels I have stayed at. The bed, pillows and blankets were fluffy and certainly a high standard. Although the toilet and bathroom setup takes the cake, it was funky and modern. All in all, this hotel surprised me and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: andreaspink
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay is located right next to the Happy Valley racecourse. Causeway Bay is a good location for business meetings, and shopping, and eating, of course. The hotel lobby is rather unimpressing, except during the Chinese New Year, when a very nice decoration is installed as an eyecatcher. The rooms are nice, modern. The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is good, the rooftop pool is a must-go. So the only real problem is the room price...typical for Hong Kong.....sky high..

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great location, cool rooms...”
Reviews.Author: TheChimps
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week here whilst on business. I'd spent the previous week in the excelsior but moved as it wasn't great. This place was far superior. The rooms were great - beautifully done with a gorgeous bathroom. The roof top bar was good and worth going for a wee drink if only for the views. All the staff were super helpful. Not cheap...but come on it's the middle of hong kong so what do you expect!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dazc459
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two days on a stopover before going home to the UK. We booked the hotel as we have stayed in the chain before, and the hotel had good reviews. We were very impressed with the hotel from start to finish. We were upgraded to a deluxe room, and it was very spacious and comfortable with a king size bed. The hotel has a small gym and a roof top (heated) pool, and everything is of a good standard. The staff could not be more professional or attentive. They were very helpful, and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is well located, being close to the nearby MTR station in Times Square and there are many shops within a few minutes walk. Would be pleased to stay at the Crowne Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ri_Sun8
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and modern, but more ideal for couples (with the sliding shower door). I was upgraded to deluxe (one king-sized bed), it was not a good idea since I was travelling with a friend, but the hotel supplemented my friend with a spare bed. Location was relatively good with easy access to the MTR, free internet was thrown-in (since I am platinum), and the bar on the top floors was wonderful to be at during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel82Uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite business focused and we were there on holiday, but this didn't bother us and our room was really nice. It was a good size, had a cool bathroom, and a comfortable bed. Pool on the roof is nice touch. There is a tube station very close to the hotel next to the Times Square Shopping Mall that will take into the centre of town and cabs were cheap. Tip: Take a copy of the hotel name in Chinese from the reception desk with you to give taxi drivers to get back to the hotel. Most taxi's were great leaving the hotel as the bell boy told them where we wanted to go, but coming back to the hotel they often struggled without the name of the hotel written in Chinese and needed to stop and ask someone.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JERRY1985
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Hotel in Hong Kong is completely over priced. The hotel is listed as a Four and half star hotel and having been in the hotel business for several years I woul clasify it as a Three Star hotel. The hotel is located in an area which is not the best of Hong Kong. The hotel unfortunately has a very bad smell as you go into the lobby and the smell can be felt throughout several of the floors I am not sure where it comes from. The food is very average and it is complety over priced ( quite expensive). The staff is very friendly and completely service oriented. The gym is extremely small. I do not feel this hotel classifies to be a Crowne Plaza hotel when comparing the property with other hotel in the US. I do feel that any traveler can get a much better deal for each dollar spent in a hotel in Hong Kong. The rooms are nice but the room rate is very high it was $240.00 US per night. Gerardo Larrea French

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: elloydn
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We upgraded on arrival to the Executive Suite and it was lovely. Plenty of room, very comfortable bed, large bathroom, big tv, multi-use phone / device charger - in short everything we needed. Service was very attentive, the bar on the roof has a good view over Happy Valley Race Course and the buffet breakfast was plentiful. Very short walk to Causeway Bay MTR and trams run back straight past the front door. Conveniently located for all the shopping Causeway Bay has to offer and a walk over the road and around the corner to Happy Valley for some night racing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, conveniently located to explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: rpripr
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in December 2010. Upgraded myself to club class room which had some amenities like free internet, free breakfast for 1, high tea & happy hour. The hotel is located very near to Times Square. The Causeway MTR station is just a couple of minutes of walk. Bus & train stops are right outside the hotel. Plenty of shopping & eating places nearby. The hotel room was very spacious & clean. Good breakfast choices. Swimming pool is on the rooftop, though did not try as it was too cold. The front lobby was helpful in explaining how to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Durban21
Reviews.Content: I must say I was a bot concerned when we booked a hotel in Causeway Bay and not Kowloon as everyone raves about Kowloon, however we were most surprised and satissfied with our hotel choice. The 1st impression is really posh and at 1st glance you can see that this is a modern hotel. The lobby seating area and chekc in is a bit small but really you are only there to check in or check out. We booked a room with a king size bed and an extra bed for my older son. The room was still spacious. The room had all modern amenities / decor and services. The work desk had a computer connection, mobile phone so that you can be on contact with the hotel if you needed to. For us this was great as we went out shopping on the 1 night and booked a babysitter with the hotel. The babysitter could call us direct on the hotel phone if there was a problem. The bathroom was huge. It had a separate shower, bath and a huge sink. Cupboard space with a safe, umbrellas, gowns, slippers etc was all great. The service of the bellman at the front door was great. We never waited for a taxi as they always got one as they saw us approaching the door. It was so easy. The gym is small but does the trick with treadmills, bicycles, weights etc. The bar and pool area at night are beautiful and the views of the city great. Causeway Bay is great as opposite the hotel you have a great sushi rest and a 7/11 which is great if you want to buy your soft drinks, cakes and other items. A 5 minute walk from the hotel brings you to Times Square which is a huge shopping centre with a great choice of a food court as well. There are plenty of shops / restuarants and the nightlife area of Wanchai is just 2 stops away via the MTR or 7 minutes by taxi for around 20HKD. I will def return to CP Causeway Bay. The hotel was fantastic. Thanks to the staff and mangement for a briilant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rare decent hotel in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: nsw2033
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with this hotel 3 times over past 6 months, both over business or holiday stay. I have to say there is no other hotel in Causeway Bay can offer as good value as Crowne Plaza. The hotel is new. Rooms are extremely clean (which I care for most). The staff are relatively helpful. And the gym just have a fantastic view over the jockey club. I just couldn't find a comparative alternative in that area at all. Hope it can keep up.

Reviews.Title: “Large room for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: EarnyinLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and wish I had booked more nights here. The hotel is close to the Causeway Bay subway station. When you exit the subway station take the exit towards Time Square and the Crowne Plaza will be a couple blocks away. Location of the hotel is in a prime area, lot of nightlife within walking distance. The lobby felt kind of small but don't judge the rest of the property by it. Staff were courteous and looked professional. The room is very big for Hong Kong standards.
