There is a nice desk to work from, the TV is pretty big and there is even a surround sound system in the room. I was impressed. The room was clean and nicely appointed. Bathroom was nice and large and even had a view. One cool thing I found in the room was there is a cell phone that can be used around HK and phone charges will be put on the room. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who is looking for a large room in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, modern, great staff and breathtaking pool!”
Reviews.Author: SMAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and was very impressed with the service level, the quality of the finishings in the hotel, the cleanliness and location of the room and the array of features the hotel had to offer. Staff were incredibly helpful, always ready to assist and the concierge out the front to help with directions and transport is great. Good location in Causeway Bay - a bit removed from the main thoroughfare of Central, but still on HK island and within ten minutes walk to the MTR station. Pool and bar on the 28th floor are incredible! Had a swim and relaxed with views over the city, and some great drinks at cheap prices. Would definitely go back, Deluxe Room on the 20th floor had everything that opens and shuts - speakers in the bathroom, great TV and DVD/sound system, most comfortable bed and fantastic insulation and soundproofing - did not hear a peep out of the neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: andy_zu
Reviews.Content: I’ve been to Hong Kong several times but I used to stay in Kowloon. So this time, I decided to stay in island part of HK and after a depth of research, I chose Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay. Turn out, this was one of my best decisions! This hotel is wonderful in most aspects and I simply would come back for my next trip to HK. I booked through their website, and since it was relatively new, I got a good deal on the rates and all became so well worth. Room Spacious for HK standard. Spotless (as most hotels in HK), bright and fresh. Smart design with earthy bright colour. Mattress was comfortable, sheets were soft and white as cloud. The best part of the room is the bathroom, which was spacious with bathtub and rain shower. Please note that the shower is in the same glass cubicle and not really separated from the bathtub, it was installed next to the tub (see pictures). The bathroom has huge glass window with a view of HK Cricket Club. All amenities are good quality, all tabs/buttons/equipment worked well. Bath robe, iron, slippers, safe deposit box, you named it. Staff Helpful, courteous, friendly and mostly can speak good English. Lobby It’s rather small and not overly impressive. But that was nothing compare to the quality of the room, facilities and service. Location You can’t beat the location. Only a short walk to Times Square & Causeway Bay MTR Station. Lots of eateries around (incl. R1968, a fine Indonesian restaurant) and shops. It’s a busy area but by then, you will feel safe as many people around till late night with adequate street lights around. All the noises from streets outside were not heard once we were in the room. Facilities I tried the swimming pool one morning. It was located in higher floors and located in front of the bar/lounge. A slim shape of pool, maybe ok for three people to do the laps at the same time, but more than that would be too crowded. We didn’t dine in the hotel nor the breakfast, because there were so many choices outside.

Reviews.Title: “One word - superb”
Reviews.Author: BigBOH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at 6am after an overnight flight from Sydney. We asked if we could pay extra for an early check in. We were offered an upgrade to a club room for about €50 per night. We got immediate check in, late check out, a larger room with wonderful views, snacks and drinks every afternoon and evening, free internet and local calls. It was worth every cent and a brilliant end to a special holiday. I can't finish without mentioning the service. It was simply outstanding throughout, with each member of staff totally bought in to providing a great experience for residents.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent BedRoom”
Reviews.Author: justin123456
Reviews.Content: Hello I stayed there in november 2010 for 3 nights. Hotel has been completely and successfully renewed. Rooms are spacious, I stayed on the 25th floor, business room. Room are really nice and large. Bathroom with the sliding door that gives you a view on your bedroom room (through a large glass)while you are taking your shower is an interesting feature. Rooms are quite very well osilated. No smell in the room.Breakfast is alright, nothing special but overall good. Business center is a bit bare. I highly recommend it for the atmosphere of comfort and luxury you get from the bedroom. Swimming pool on the roof top is interesting but I didn t feel like trying it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: paultse_uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the one of the Crown Plaza's deluxe rooms and it was undoubtedly the finest "non-suite" room I've been in by a margin! Even trumps the 5* JW Marriott executive room in HK (which is hardly shabby itself!). Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay in this Hotel Again”
Reviews.Author: erickennystankyle
Reviews.Content: Heard from the staff that the hotel is just 12 months old. The decor looks modern and trendy; very uplifting, compared to some older hotels around the Causeway Bay area. Location 1) Minutes away from the shopping belt, restaurants, cafes, and the subway. A very central location for shopping. Rooms 1) We got a deluxe room and the size was very good. Furniture, Furnishing and Lightning were all very modern and coordinated. Ceiling was also much higher than other near-by hotels, thus giving you a good feeling of the space when you enter the room. Being a new hotel, the room was clean and well-maintained. The view from the room was not much to rave about though. We got the view facing the opposite building, therefore, the curtains were drawn most of the time. 2) The bathroom was a definite plus. Generous space and the lighting was bright and cozy. Separate shower and long bath area was very welcomed. The sliding door mentioned in other reviews was a clever design idea and we could watch TV while showering at the same time. The only drawback was the sink/vanity area. It gets a little flooded with water when we wash up. The water stayed around the table top and flow onto the floor if we don't wipe up on time. Minus The following are not really negatives, but more of personal preferences and observations. 1) Breakfast on Sunday morning was chaotic. The whole dinning area was crowded with people. Food and beverages tend to run out and not being refilled on time. Tables and dishes were also not promptly cleared. Management should consider having more staff during peak periods, else, the tables looked very untidy. Situations on weekday mornings were not as bad. The spread for breakfast was rather standard; no surprises. 2) Received a rather impolite reply (we feel) when we checked-in. We asked for a nice room and was told that our reserved room is already very nice and the next best room would be a suite. A polite and happy - "Certainly!" would have been much more welcomed. Actually, we wouldn't have known that at the end of the day, the same reserved room was given to us. However, it would have made the checked-in experience much more pleasant and the hotel being portrayed as a very responsive hotel; without additional cost to them. Overall, as compared to the other hotels around the vicinity, this hotel stands out mainly because the hotel is new and therefore very clean and modern. The size of the room is also generous for Hong Kong's standard. Will stay in this hotel again if returning to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerberas99
Reviews.Content: Having been to Hong Kong a few times, I must say this is the best hotel I've stayed in. We were upgraded to a deluxe room on arrival. Room is of a decent size, modern with quality finishing. The TV was of superb resolution, and the surround sound system really made tv-watching such a pleasant experience. There's even a dvd player for those who want to relax in bed and watch a dvd movie. Bed (king size) was very comfortable, bathroom very clean and spacious, with rainshower. The room also came with an iphone docking station which we were very happy with since we didn't bring along our phone charger. Hotel is situated just a 5-min walk away from Times Square / Causeway Bay MTR. It is near the main shopping belt of Tsim Sha Tsui (just three MTR stops away), yet far away from the noise and crowd. Overall, a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Up-to-date business hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherryPuppy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Causeway Bay, and not far from Times Square, the location for New Year's Eve celebrations in Hong Kong. The surrounding area has a range of local restaurants with international options available in the shopping centers which are around 5 minutes walk. The check-in process was efficient, and I received an upgrade due to my frequent guest status with the IHG hotel chain. Room was spacious with a range of high-tech add-ons, the most impressive of which was a GSM mobile phone connected to the room extension which could be used all over Hong Kong. I had a nice view of the Happy Valley Racecourse, and if you are staying on a Wednesday, you can watch the race right from your room (if you are lucky enough to have a suitably located room). The room had all the usual Crowne Plaza features, including the rain shower, of which I am a big fan. It was also very spacious - a rarity in Hong Kong. The main restaurant does not have a very exciting menu, so only eat there if you are forced to, otherwise take a short walk to Times Square and surrounds for other options. The bar on the top floor is quite nice, interesting decor and good service with a decent happy hour. This was a regular stop during my stay. A good business hotel, and its new so everything is fresh and up-to-date. Location is OK as well, depending on what your visit purpose is. Kowloon is a couple of MTR stops away (MTR station is at Times Square). The Convention Centre is a 20 minute walk. A taxi will take from somewhere between 12 minutes to 25 minutes, depending on traffic conditions - its also a bit hard to get a taxi straight away due to the hotel location at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: deeceeHonolulu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new with spacious (for HongKong), modern rooms. Price (ca. $200) is very reasonable for HongKong. Location is great for walking around, only five minutes from Times Square with its many restaurants and shops. The area is very much a local scene that captures life in HongKong. The hotel is also close to a wet market with fresh fruits, veggies, meat, fish, etc. Beds are very comfortable and free wifi is available. Downside is that room does not come with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTravelBug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and new, only opened 11 months ago. We booked the superior room, and were happy to find out that it was quite spacious. The bathroom has both shower stall and tub, with modern and high quality fixtures. When we first entered our room, we were surprised to see the shower stall was visible from the bedroom area through a glass wall. Then we discovered there is a decorative sliding wall in the bedroom that can be moved to cover the shower stall for privacy. Though we were on the 11th floor, we still had a nice view of Happy Valley race course and the hills behind. The bar/lounge, the swimming pool and the exercise room on the 27th and 28th floors have good views of the surrounding areas, especially at night. Breakfast in the hotel was quite good, with both Asian and Western selections. The hotel is within short walking distance to Time Square, Causeway Bay subway station, Jardine Bazaar, numerous shops and restaurants. The only drawback of the hotel is that it has a very small lobby. It looks quite chaotic when many people check in at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crown Plaza and was upgraded to one of their suites. Very nice and spacious room, including two bathrooms, two Tv's all complete with ipod docking stations. Service was very attentive from arrival until check out. Location is also very convenient to the various office locations around.

Reviews.Title: “Unreal, modern, clean, great rooms, good food and service”
Reviews.Author: Misscammy
Reviews.Content: Great new modern hotel. We spent one night only in HK but this was recomended by a friend living in HK. 12mth old at the time, great rooms, so funky and spacious. Bathrooms are trendy and huge, very upper class and high tech tv and ipod ports. Short walk to Times Square and massage place. Had a great massage down the road which was reccommended by hote. We missed b'fast as we accidently slept in. Had buffet for dinner one evening, too much food, would had rathered a proper meal. Lamb was very under cooked and looked horrible. But, that was the only little thing wrong. Otherwise, FAB hotel. Nice pool area and bar upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great View & Very Quite”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as I wished to goto the races at happy valley. we arrived to very courteous staff and couldn't believe the view of the room of happy valley , we had room 1401, overlooking the track, fantastic, the bath is also overlooking the track and surrounding area. The rooms have the latest gadgets, including DVD player, IPOD player and I was offered free internet, which these days should be free I think anyway at hotels. The pool on the top floor is well worth a visit, more great views. All in all one of the better Crowne Plaza's I have stayed at worldwide, Highly recommend. One last thing, which we love , we did not here a thing all night, so quite, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic business hotel - and close to the shopping”
Reviews.Author: Varvara1
Reviews.Content: This hotels was first class - location is great (right behind Times Square) and a 5 minute walk from the MTR. The rooms are outstanding and we managed to get an upgrade with a view of the Happy Valley Racecourse. Couldn't fault a thing - rooms, restaurant, bar - all A++++++++. Would definitely stay here when in Hong Kong next time

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jtung74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay in September for 3 nights. Overall very good hotel and nothing too negative. The location of the hotel is good, being few hundred meters away from Causeway Bay metro station and the Time Square. However if you arrive with big luggage perhaps you would want to avoid the metro – it’s a long walk after leaving the train. Check in was done efficiently although the staff wasn’t particularly friendly. However this is Hong Kong and unless you stay at some $$$ hotels don’t expect too much smile. Room is very clean and well design. I particularly like the TV system and the funky bathroom. It’s definitely the best Crowne Plaza I have stayed at. The room is also very quiet. Agree on previous review that the rooms with view toward Happy Valley are much better than city view. During my stay I made the most of the roof top swimming pool. It’s essential during the summer months. Sometimes I was just tired of browsing the endless shopping malls and this place is an oasis. I found shopping in Hong Kong actually very boring and expensive, so tend to spend my time eating Dim Sum, swimming and do a bit sightseeing. Service at the pool side was great. Overall this is a very solid hotel but next time I might try some other new additions (Upper House perhaps).

Reviews.Title: “New, stylish hotel with some dubious parties on top floor”
Reviews.Author: Inspector_to_be
Reviews.Content: Great location for shoppers and those who are after a more urban location in HK. A very stylish hotel, with spacious and very well appointed rooms. It fully understands needs of business travellers, and implements little things that make their stay a lot easier. A good television with iPod dock, speakers and great range of channels. Each room also comes with a mobile phone that doubles as a hotel phone, so you can stay connected while out of the hotel – a sensational idea. The common areas are also top class, with a spacious restaurant, well-manned business centre and an outdoor smoking patio. The two floors at the top of the hotel are also public areas. The 27th floor holds a fantastic lounge-style patio, with great outdoor seating, city views and, in the evenings, beverage service. The top floor holds a bar and swimming pool deck. Again, amazing décor. We were there over the weekend so saw first hand how busy the hotel can get. There was a pool party on on Sunday afternoon, which I found quite odd, but interesting nonetheless. It was clearly a function organised by outside guests, but in-house guests were able to use the pool deck and dodge the entry fee - although two families that had obviously planned a quiet afternoon by the pool didn’t seem pleased with the inconvenience of a pool party (that was not out of hand but messy nonetheless). I must admit that I share this disappointment with them. This came after the bar being closed for a private function the day before. Staff were helpful and courteous but there were long waits, specially at reception on check in and check out. Overall a great stay, seeing that I was there on leisure, but had I been there on business and after some quiet time, I would have been disappointed with the lack of care for in-house guests privately using the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel perfectly located and with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: Usually I’m not a fan of this kind of hotel, most of the time, charm less and without any interest. However, surprisingly, the experience at Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay has been more than good. Located in the busy but super trendy area of Causeway Bay facing the race course of Happy Valley, this new and elegant hotel offers an excellent quality of service and comfort. Right away you’ll arrive, you’ll be welcome by a very friendly and efficient staff. We arrived late at night and immediately after I said we booked for a Crowne Plaza Club room, a charming girl escorted us to the second floor for a private check in next to the Club Lounge. Everything has been done with elegance, professionalism and a lot of kindness asking us how was our flight, giving us details about the benefits of the Club lounge… Unfortunately, nobody escorted us into our room and in a five stars hotel we expect this service… Anyway, we discovered the room by ourselves. Nicely decorated, very spacious and with a fantastic view on Happy Valley (very interesting on Wednesday evening when there are race courses…). We found the bathroom extremely comfortable with a separate rain shower opened on the bedroom (but you still can close a wood door if you wanna privacy…) and a deep bathtub. There is a very good equipment in the room and even a mobile phone not to miss any call when you go out (A precious service free of charge and only the calls you’ll give will be charged). Regarding the breakfast, we have been very happy to have a very good buffet with an extensive choice and a great quality of food (the smoked salmon was excellent) and again, a very nice staff to take care of you and especially Maggie who has been so nice with us… But, if I have to select one specific thing making of this hotel a very special place in HK, it would be the amazing terrace at the 37th floor named Pavilion. A huge perfectly designed space where you can enjoy a cocktail with the most beautiful views and a nice wind. We went there for a drink and we were so good we finally had a light dinner in a wonderful atmosphere, trendy, cool and relaxing. On the upper floor, there is even a pool, not so large, but very good and again with excellent views and a bar more and more popular in HK with a beautiful crowd. So, let’s say this hotel is truly a great choice and for this quality, the rates are just impressive. For under HKD 1800 per night, this is a gift… There are just a few details to improve like a disagreeable smell in the lobby or an average quality of amenities but this is probably the best choice you can do in HK if you don’t wanna make your bank account empty and find a place which is able to exceed the highest expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldAzntourist
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza is a good choice if you travel for business in Hong Kong. Rates are usually competitive and location is generally good (next to major MTR station). Majoritarily Mainland Chinese clientele. Can be quite noisy when you are the unluckly one getting the room next to screaming children. Would never use this hotel for a personal travel with spouse as it's pretty much a business setup. Service is good and staff does some effort, but it appears very "robotic". Obviously the hotel can not compete with the Four Seasons and both Mandarin Oriental hotels but again it's playing in another range and much lower level of sophistication.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 stay”
Reviews.Author: doc105
Reviews.Content: the hotel is gr8. The service and food is good. The best part is that hotel provides you a mobile with a sim card, which the guest can use in hong kong. The hotel is jst 5 min from MTR station and has good shopping area around. The staff was very good and helpful, I would definitely like to come back

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: flipforc3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid August and had a great time there. Great hotel IMO.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great; wish the location was just slightly more central”
Reviews.Author: snaily7
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in a deluxe room with a friend. The hotel, which I believe was less than a year old at my date of stay, was clean, fresh and very pleasant. Chill live music from the ground floor cafe. A refuge from the bustle of Hong Kong, with a really really comfortable bed, large TV and really generous space (compared to some rabbitholes I'd stayed at in HK previously). The bathroom is pretty clean and nice too with a rainshower and tub. Oh and the room even comes with a mobile phone (with local SIM card/number that you can bring around and have HKers contact you on). We used it to make restaurant reservations. But it's not as centrally located in Causeway Bay as hoped - it's a 7-10 min walk to an entrance of the Causeway Bay MTR station, and a bit more of a walk after that before you reach the main train platforms. Navigating the MTR and walk back was a bit of a downer after a long, tiring day pounding the streets. There's also no proper pedestrian crossing in front of the hotel and on top of 4-lane traffic, there's also a tram line running just outside. Friend and I were nearly run over by a tram (which came out of nowhere, we swear!) while attempting to jaywalk to our hotel. After that we stuck to the designated crossing 5 mins away. If you're lucky, you can even get a view of the Happy Valley race course (we were on the 19th floor and could see the track; albeit at a distance). Unfortunately, it wasn't race day during our stay. Pool was small and intimidating, being located right next to the rooftop bar. Needless to say, we were too chicken.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return again”
Reviews.Author: Helicraz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new, and very clean. Roof top pool is small/short, but still not too bad for a work out. Room is good for business travelers, with essential stationary provided. They even provide a in-city cell phone with a local number to use. Room is big, in terms of typical HK hotel size. Been to several hotels in HK, this is one of few that they have a good design maximizing the small area without making the room feel even tiny. Lots of glass panels. Since the shower is totally clear glass. For anyone who prefer more modesty, they will need to use the bathtub to shower. The elevator is a little pain, as I saw many other hotel guest having trouble getting the key card read by the elevator, By the time the elevator recognize their card, it already by pass their level or is heading the wrong direction. Room service choices is limited, but no worries, convenience stall and food is 5 minutes across the road. It will be good if the hotel can provide suger free sweeteners in the room bar.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAPreston_UK
Reviews.Content: Amazing value! Amazing room & quality. Amazing roof top bar and pool. Amazing service. The restaurant wasn't great. Ideal for the MTR and Time Square. Will definitely stay again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: TLA80
Reviews.Content: Booked a club room and was upgraded for free to an Executive suite - absolutely huge!! basically it is an additional lving room and bathroom with 180 degrees views. Couldn't fault anything with this hotel, the breakfast was divine. I would recommend staying here, and going with a club/executive room if your budget allows it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms quite small for more than 2 people”
Reviews.Author: jenniferhc
Reviews.Content: Luckily, we only stayed here for 1 night. We had a queen bed, barely enough room for a baby crib and our 4 year old tried to sleep on the settee, but ended up in bed with my husband and me. The room was quite clean, nice, and with a good location to Victoria Peak and the Central Market.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PChua
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel. 2 minutes to Times Square and all the shopping that Causeway Bay has to offer. If you are coming for a shopping trip, this is it! got a great F&F rate thus excellent value. would not pay anymore than HK$1400 if i can help it though. As it is new, amenities in the room as well as facilities are still looking good. Service was only so-so at reception but did not bother us at all. met expectations of a good 4 star hotel. some nice restaurants for dim sum nearby as well

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find”
Reviews.Author: Alexatravel
Reviews.Content: Stopover for 3 nights from Aus to UK, and to catch up with friends here. Booked on basis of TA reviews and we were not disappointed. Booked Club room at good rate (over weekend), wonderful room every amenity, free broadband and HK mobile - nice touch. Club lounge very good, lovely to experience afternoon tea following a hectic day. Good pre dinner snacks and drinks (you could probably have sufficient to forgoe dinner). Breakfast in main dining area excellent, fantastic range. Club level staff very helpful. If possible book Happy Valley view room, much nicer if you are fussy about views, we didn't, but would have preferred - although how much time will you spend looking out of the window?

Reviews.Title: “Great Roof Top pool”
Reviews.Author: Travellor555
Reviews.Content: Amazing view from the roof top, also has a small pool. Hotel itself was nice too. Efficient service, helpful concierge. We had a great view of Happy Valley sports ground / Mountains from our hotel room. Great spot.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chetiVenezia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel-new one, Great loction- close to the underground Wonderful breakfast western and asian cuisine Rooms are confortable, wioth all the necessaire Very nice the pool on the top

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: Tysin30
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps the best hotel in Hong Kong, in terms of location and value for money, it is a very modern and newly designed hotel with very nice staff Only one problem is that as a Royal Ambassador Member of this group of hotels, almost every other hotel in the chain does provide free access to the club lounge, but this hotel does not so perhaps they do not value loyalty like all others? Anyway, it is a great hotel I would still recommend it very much to anyone coming to HK

Reviews.Title: “Connecting Rooms and City Wide Mobile are definite plus!”
Reviews.Author: DNLs_mum
Reviews.Content: Why we pick this hotel: We are a family of 2 adults and 3 kids, aged 13, 10, 4. We picked Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay mainly because they had connecting rooms and were able to guarantee them to us at booking rather than just subject to availability like most other hotels. Having connecing rooms meant that we had more liveable space. If we did not have them, we were likely to have spent time in one room and use the second only for baths and sleeping. I was able to get the rooms at my company's corporate rate HKD1100 per room per nite and it comes with free internet which was very helpful. The location: The hotel is a short walk from the Causeway bay MTR exit at Times Square. However, since there was 5 of us, we took cabs most of the time. We also wanted to conserve the energy of my 4 year old for the sight seeing activities rather than for walking to transportations. Taxi cost is very reasonable anyway. The rooms: The connecting rooms were cnfigured with one king connecting to a twin which worked fine for us and my little girls likes to share a bed with my husband and I. My 2 older boys had a room to themselves and could do anything they wanted in the afternoons even when their sister was taking her nap. The rooms were spacious and has a very nice comtemporary deco. Very pleasant and comfortable. The duvets were thick and comfy. My sons say that its the best they ever had. The rain shower in the bathroom was great. My boy enjoyed that too. The rooms we had no view and looked to other buildings, but we were not bothered. One of the best things that this hotel provide is City-wide mobile. We could take the mobile phones provided in each room out with us and can call room to room or back to the hotel at no charge. This was especially useful since we had 2 rooms, and my husband and I took a phone each and could get in touch with each other when we split up for our activities in Ocean park. The meals: We did not try the buffet breakfast since we felt that they were quite ex. We did orderd room service breakfast on one of the mornings. We had a local set and an American set. The food, especially the noodles, was way too salty. A breakfast at Tsui Wah, a local "tea restaurant" was much more satisfying and provided better value. The service: Conceirge was helpful and made reservations for us at Yung Kee. Other then that, my aunt who lives in HK and visited us on various occasions found the service staff lacking in warm and local knowledge. They were downright snooty on some ocassions, perhaps because she was very casually dressed and did not carry branded stuff? Conclusion: I'll still stay in this hotel again just for the connecting rooms and the city wide mobile.

Reviews.Title: “a credit to the IC hotels”
Reviews.Author: cecilette
Reviews.Content: We had a great holiday in Hong Kong much to the credit of the hotel. The room was very nice, modern, spacious and clean. Although we had an ordinary view (rooms 05, 07 etc have a better view, make a request when booking). The bathroom is superb. The pool is stunning. Breakfast out of this world. Location is perfect , 100m from Times Square mall with a great food hall in the basement and Causeway metro station. I can't find anything wrong to say.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and good value”
Reviews.Author: EalingExpat
Reviews.Content: Well located and brand new. Decent sized nice rooms. Great roof top bar. Only problem was the pool was not yet open and had specifically booked the hotel so my young son could use the pool. This caused some tension but eventually the manager got involved and was helpful - the other front desk staff were quite poor. I will certainly visit again, and look forward to seeing how the service has matured.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: BfmacSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business. The breakfast buffet is very nice and the bar on the top floor is also nice. The beds were too hard for my liking so I did not sleep well but the rooms were fully modern . The room included a speaker system that is connected to in room speakers including the bathroom which was very nice. Nice work space and wireless connection in room

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... perhaps the best in Causeway Bay!”
Reviews.Author: mkjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights. Loved the hotel and the price at the IHG FNF rate of HK$945 made it all the better. Would stay again in a heart beat. We were upgraded to a room on the 18th floor with a view of the race track. You could actually see the races from your room. Pluses: loved the entertainment system that allowed you to play an iphone through the TV so I could play my child's videos; location close to Causeway Bay Station was great - although it's a long walk to the actual train platforms - this is not uncommon in many places in HKG; great bathroom amenities in case you forgot something; loved the Reidel Glassware in the room - and the many wine stores around to stock the room up with; the roof top pool was to die for and we took advantage of its use on several days to cool us down from the HKG heat; loved the separate shower and bath; large bathroom; huge room in a city where space is a premium; very quiet room and nice powerful AC that was very quiet; view of happy valley that was spectacular. Minuses: staff was not helpful on restaurant recs and no dedicated concierge; very expensive internet rates (HK$120 per day or HK$40 per hour) and expensive computer use rates at the business center. I did not eat at the hotel restaurants so can not assess but the prices looked reasonable at the bar on the 27/28 floor.

Reviews.Title: “Gd location but some of the staffs totally SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: blueariel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through my corporate rate and it was really affordable. At the rate that i paid, there is nothing better than this. The hotel location is superb. ONE minute walk from causeway bay and the buses at the bus stop outside the hotel brings you to Central/Wan Chai in a breeze. Rooms are very pretty and new that comes with DVD player, handphone on loan, bathroom overlooking causeway bay. For that money, i really shouldnt complain. But, i must really comment on the hotel should be more consistent on their service especially the staff's attitude. Their service standard is not consistent. Majority of them are quite okay but there's this few front desk staffs who behaved like i "owed them money". They were impatient towards me and were not helpful at all. I travelled with my old parents and unlike all the other service providers i met during my travel in HKG, the staffs at CP could not care less. Before i booked the room, i was actually quoted two different rates even though i asked for the same corporate rate! I also requested for connecting rooms but upon checked in, they did not have the rooms. Next, at the check in counter, i further reminded the reception that i needed a rollaway bed in one of the rooms and i understood that i have to pay extra for that. She acknowledged but after checking in, she happily forgot about the bed. I had to remind the hotel for the THIRD time then the bed was sent. They also did not attach a third room key when there were three paying guests in the room! On its website, it is stated that we could do a late checkout of up to 4pm. As my dad has walking diffculty, we wanted him to stay in the room for the last day since we were checking out only in the evening. However, when we checked with the reception, they insisted that we have to check out at 12 or pay an additional half day but the "half day" rate was equivilent to what we paid for our ONE day. It was the last straw. I've stayed in enough hotels to know that i deserve to be treated better. Crowne Plaza Hong Kong was a disappointment. I will not stay in this hotel again and i will not recommend to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: walkingheels
Reviews.Content: I generally don't write reviews but this hotel so deserves one. I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay with my parents and husband recently, and because I brought my parents I wanted to make sure that the hotel was decent, had a good pool and had great location so not much walking was required for the older folks. This property met all my expectations and more. When you go to Hong Kong you generally don't expect a large room but the CP had very spacious, new and modern rooms. Location was fabulous - a stone's throw away from Times Square, very accessible and convenient for food and shopping. I booked through the hotel website and got a very good deal. Definitely will return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “NEW HOTEL, GOOD LOCATION, GREAT ROOM”
Reviews.Author: lexa1982
Reviews.Content: A new hotel in causeway bay, very close to time square, about 5mins walk. The room is good, very comfortable bed, just because of the weather in hongkong, makes the bed very bed, couldn't sleep well. The staff are very friendly,except one guy working at the front table, not helping at all. Room service menu is very little, same menu as in the hotel restarant. Not much food to have. Cleaning lady did a really good job!!! Overall great hotel for a short stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, traditional service”
Reviews.Author: MarsbarNorthants
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel ! Lovely big, bright modern bedrooms - the bathroom was fantastic and the room itself enjoyed a great view over Happy Valley racecourse - shame no horse race meeting as that would be truly spectacular. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful - indeed the young girl in the club reception even sorted out a problem with a laptop I bought that morning. She phoned the shop and got them ready for my return to correct a programming problem with it. As a member of the Holiday Inn chain I even got bonus points on my Priority Club membership. Only a short walk to Times Square and the main Causeway Bay shopping area with all it's restaurants and other attractions. I may even be tempted to change from my regular hotel - The Excelsior........Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT New Property in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I write this review from a room on the 23rd floor...Checking out tomorrow after 4 nights here. I couldn't wait to write a review on this place...Basically, I echo what everyone else says below--a great hotel, great rooms, great service....All around A+ property. It's a small footprint of a property, only 8-10 rooms per floor and a small lobby, but that doesn't take away at all from this full-service hotel...Main restaurant is a level up, with more hotel features a floor above that and a cool bar on the 28th floor. It's not the Peninsula or the Conrad, but for a upscale yet reasonable hotel, I've found myself a new home in Hong Kong. I pre-reserved an Club Floor standard room and was upgraded to a Deluxe room as a PC Platinum member. Knowing this is Hong Kong, the room pretty good size-wise, bigger than most in HK, but certainly not 'huge'. The bathroom is phenomenal, and the amenities in the room are tops--iPod hookup, 42" flat-panel TV, and, if you choose, a cell phone in the room to take around town with you (I declined since I have a HK phone). The Club Level (Executive Floor) rooms are worth it, about HK400 more than a regular room. Includes internet access, a pretty good breakfast (served in their main restaurant) and the evening reception has some great food (enough for me for dinner most nights), great selection of booze, beers and soft drinks, and not all that crowded. The only thing different versus most executive floors was that the lounge is on the 2nd floor, slightly inconvenient all the way down and up in the elevators...But certainly not enough to detract from the overall quality of this property. I'll be back in HK two more times this year, and surely will book here again...I hate the hustle and bustle of Kowloon and their old and dated hotels. This is a new, modern, quiet property in an otherwise busy area--if you like a scene, Causeway Bay is nice, but the hotel is a great escape from it all...I hear nothing below me as I write this. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights here and was upgraded to Exeutive room as a platinum PC member, Very good welcome with efficient check-in. Everyone polite and keen to help. My room was excellent--spacious, modern and well-equipped. If this is your first visit to HKG you might find the Causeway Bay area crowded and initially confusing. However, once explained, the ttransport llinks are good and could get you anywherer in HKG, but you are not in the central business or harbour area. That siad, this is an excellent hotel and well worthy of its Crowne Plaxa status. If

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and new hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Briggsy64
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel as part of a 'look see' of Hong Kong as we were moving there. We chose the hotel for it's central location, the fact that it was quite new and the few reviews were good and also because it had a pool that was open in March (most don't). We booked 2 connecting rooms as we had a 3 year old and a 9 month old baby and were staying for a long period, but on arrival found the children's room stunk of smoke. After a little bit of confusion we were upgraded to a suite and the following day were also given a connecting room, so we had both a living area and 2 bedrooms (including 3 toilets!!). The decor was really nice, modern and not too 'hotel like' and the floor to ceiling windows gave lots of light. The rooms were very spacious, especially for HK, but then we did have lots of extra space, which we really appreciated! We ate breakfast at the hotel a few times which was fine, a reasonable selection, but we were sometimes charged for our 3 year old (they were inconsistent on this) which was a bit over the top as there was just a set price. We had room service lots of times and the quality varied depending on the dish, ironically the western style dishes (pasta, burger) were great, the Asian ones less so apart from the vege curry which was fantastic. Service was very friendly and generally helpful although sometimes language was a problem with a few restaurant staff only. The pool was lovely, although as the weather was unseasonably cold we only used it once! Gym although small was well equipped. The location is very handy, right next to Times Square and Lee Gardens shopping complexes, lots of restaurants etc and was very central for travelling to different parts of the island. Downside is the area is very polluted (it was particularly bad that week) so not great for walking, but Happy Valley racecourse is next door which was green and away from the cars and a public playground at one end got lots of use from us!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mardrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights as part of our recent trip to Hong Kong. It was in an excellent location - only a couple of minutes away from a shopping centre and loads of other shops and the MTR. It is also just a short walk or tram ride to Happy Valley Racecourse.We found all the staff to be so friendly and helpful. Check-in/check-out was quick and efficient. We also loved the modern styling of the rooms with the good quality fixtures and fittings. If we ever return to Hong Kong we would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice high tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: markhongkong
Reviews.Content: Redeemed a night using my priority club points when my friend came over to Hong Kong to visit. Hotel is very new and very nicely decorated. Hotel comes with niceties like a mobile phone for you to take around town (with charge), ipod charger with connection to tv and overhead speakers Having stayed in a quite a lot of Holiday Inn and Holiday Inn express, this is definitely one of the best in terms of in room decoration and amenities Located in Causeway Bay, the shopping area of Hong Kong and 5 minutes from subway, you can't get more centralized than this. Noise insulation is also top notch, I can't help but noticed how quiet it is when I step into the room (especially when you consider the hotel is located like 10 metre from a busy road with tram) Overall it is a very good hotel, I know average price is 1500 HKD up, which is not cheap but not unacceptable for hotel this level

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel I have stayed at in years”
Reviews.Author: Delegator
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite new, and it shows to the benefit of anybody staying there. The rooms are excellent, there are multiple restaurants including a wonderful open-air level that offers drinks and some very creative appetizers. The location in the Causeway Bay area of Hong Kong is all hustle and bustle, but the hotel also overlooks the horse racing track which is great fun to watch (from a distance) on a Wednesday night. Of all the cities I've visited in Asia this is one to which I really want to return first -- and this is the hotel at which I would stay. One note: my company has a corporate rate that includes free internet and breakfast. Your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: yingyingeng
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller as I do some travel for work too and this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in for a long time. It has a great central location and easy to get to from the MTR, in fact there are even signs to indictate whch exit to take for the hotel! Once we arrived at the hotel the staff were very efficient and helpful and very friendly. We were very quickly checked in and went up to our rooms which was a relief after a 13hr flight from LHR. At first we were a bit anxious about the room as HK is very space sensitive with a high population in a small area but to our relief our room was spacious enough we felt comfortable even with two big suitcases in the room:) The room itself was clean and very nicely decorated. Being new they made good use of the space and put in all the mod cons you would need. They are even thoughtful enough to provide you with a mobile phone and travel adaptors which I thought was a nice touch. During our stay we made use of the gym and the pool, both of which was not very big but was adequete for our use. The only thing I would say about the gym was that it would have been nice if they had a rowing machine as I do that regularly at the gym back home. But the pool was great - no issues with that at all. I loved the fact that after a few lengths you can relax and take a rooftop view of the city from the pool:) Altogether we spent 7 days in the Crown Plaza before moving on to visit friends in Singapore. And I must say that although we stayed at the Intercontinental there which is a 5* in the IHG family as opposed to the 4* of Crown Plaza, I much preffered the Crown Plaza in terms of cleaniness,decor and service.

Reviews.Title: “High-tech, clean, comfortable. Like the future should be.”
Reviews.Author: travelerlnd
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on Tuesday, I was greeted by two young men who insisted on delivering my bags. Check in was fast and efficient. Hotel was brand new, so clean and modern are almost understatements. The location near Times Square and Wen Chai made this hotel even better. The rooms were really comfortable, clean and came decked out with the newest flat screen tv, awesome speakers, speakers in the bathroom. Well. I have to say I think the Bathrooms and the views are what really did it for me. I could take a rain shower and look out at Happy Valley race track at the same time. Oh yeah and the roof top bar was really cool too. Great stay

Reviews.Title: “Some Service Glitches - Otherwise Nice”
Reviews.Author: JFH1107
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights in January 2010. The room was new and comfortable, with an exceptionally large and well-accomodated bathroom. In-room soundproofing was excellent, something I'm very sensitive to. It was annoying however, to have to phone the front desk for a new internet password every 24 hours. My stay would have been excellent except for some odd experiences with service staff: #1. went to the roof to look at the swimming pool and garden (fabulous!). Within 15 seconds a staff person wondered if he could help me. "Just wanted to take a look at the pool." "The pool is for our hotel guests only." Umm, yeah, thanks for making me feel so welcome! #2. breakfast day one. I was one of maybe 10 people in the restaurant. Several staff members would walk back and forth with coffee and tea but never turn their heads to the side, just straight ahead and back again. "Okay, surely this time they'll see me, and I'll catch their eye." Nope. Finally had to walk up to the service counter and ask for coffee. #3. breakfast day two. An exact repeat of day one. Unbelievable! Days 3 and 4 - I made sure to sit next to the service area. Lastly, after spending 4 nights here I would think at least once someone would have addressed me by name. Didn't happen. Oh well. Would I stay here again? Maybe if the price was right - I had a much better overall experience at Langham Place 2 years ago. But this hotel is better located.

Reviews.Title: “More than met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: TuanBesar69
Reviews.Content: Wife & I stayed for 3 nights for the first time at this hotel and this part of Hong Kong. Usually, we stay at the Intercontinental on Kowloon so that we can have the view of the harbour traffic and Hong Kong Island. This hotel was everything that we expected and considerably cheaper than the Intecon. We had a Club Room overlooking the Happy Valley Racecourse with the lovely green mountain in the background. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom really cool, the internet connection fast, the pool warm enough, the gym well-equipped, the breakfast buffet bountiful, the hotel staff extremely attentive. We found the location very convenient with several high-end shopping centers and a metro stop within a few blocks. Only negatives were the difficulty that we had in getting the room temperature above 19 degrees Centigrade and the sparseness of the hor's d'oeuvres selection at the Happy Hour in the Club Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong just became better!”
Reviews.Author: Endesu
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Hong Kong several times, I have never really found a hotel to suit me nor a location that made me want to come back. But in this hotel I found both! Great staff (always someone on hand to help), great design and ambience, very nice rooms and a good location makes this hotel my new home in HK. The hotel is new, opened in 2009, and the rooms are high tech with great amenities and are being kept tidy and clean at all times. The view is not bad and the rooms are quiet and shielded from noise outside, which can often be a problem in China. Beds are soft and comfortable, internet is fast and there is even a surround sound system with subwoofer, BBC never sounded this good in a hotel before. Location is also great, made this my best stay in HK so far. Close to subway, shopping and tons of restaurants, you will not be bored around this hotel. Usually I have no problems finding drawbacks with a hotel, but with this one I can not think of any. All in all a top notch place, and like previous posters, I am already looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return - one our best hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFamily049
Reviews.Content: As a family with 2 small children we took connecting rooms. The setting, location, views, service, food, rooms & bathrooms were all wonderful. Chef, Heinz Oertli & his team cooked & served up a glorious, interesting & companionable selection, presented it exquisitely & was as sublimely flavorful. Only complaint was the attitude of the sole waitress in the club lounge...

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: nurns28
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay this week. Overall, the facilities are brand new, high-tech, and modern. Rooms are clean and look strikingly similar to Le Meridien Shanghai (I wonder if it was the same designer). It is in a good location, about 2 minutes walking distance to Times Square and the Lee Garden shopping and dining right near by. However, the service at the hotel is a bit lacking. Two nights in a row now I have returned to my room around 9pm local time to find various cigarette buts extinguished ON TOP of the little trash can outside of the elevators on my floor. The trash receptacle is not one made for extinguishing cigarette butts, as I am on a non-smoking floor. What's worse? They are STILL there when I leave my room around 9am! It is smelly and gross, and very disappointing that in a full 12 hours not one staff member has taken the time to clean this up. Likewise, I have noticed on my floor that old room service trays with food remnants linger on the floor of my hallway for 12+ hours with no one picking them up. One more minor pet peeve, for a hotel that clearly caters to business travelers it is annoying to have to call the front desk, be put on hold, transferred 3 times every 24 hours to obtain an internet passcode. Nice facilities but these little issues add up to some unpleasantries in what could be an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New location with magic rooftop amenities”
Reviews.Author: zoomer-7
Reviews.Content: I'll be back - its only 2 months old and they've got the formula right from the get go. The staff are pleasant and the decor very 2010. The hotel is located near a corner site and like all buildings in Hong Kong, thin yet wide - one central corridor with rooms either side. The hotel is situated on a main road in Causeway Bay and a few blocks away from the legendary Times Square shopping area - the location is excellent. There's tons of space in the room considering the site and every conceivable thing is catered for - AV inputs for computer to 50" LCD TV, iPod dock, surround sound (ok - I love gadgets!). The bathroom has a moveable bedroom wall which exposes the bathroom and also means you can see TV while taking a shower (yes - the bathroom speaker works great). The marble bathroom contains a bath (not spa) and monsoon / removable shower choice. The desk is well positioned so you can work with natural outside light over the shoulder. The bed is huge and "firm but fair" with a pillow menu on offer. Being an internet guy, I think the Hotel could do better with getting reasonable priced / free Internet on offer. After my 24 hours expired, I searched for free wireless alternatives outside the window. The cost of HK$140 / 24 hours is a little on the high / silly side. The Gym is amazing - it's such a prime position overlooking the HK Jockey Club on the top floor and is small yet you don't feel overwhelmed with machines. Though tempting, the bar on the the same floor (which is just reward after working out!?) overlooking the city and the heated pool (kept at 28 deg we are told). The outdoor shower by the pool is a one of the world's strangest places to cleanse before a dip! very cool. Downstairs from here (two flights of stairs) is the "Pavilion" which is a Sky Garden and with the combination of seating, small ponds and great service, this place is a great hangout over Hong Kong. We only ate breakfast at the restaurant in the morning. The selection and service is excellent and I recommend the dim sum for breakfast! Beware though of the over-zealous staff who will remove your used plate a nano-second after you've eaten the last morsel on it. The Espresso is excellent. Crowne Plaza must be very proud of this property - I'm coming back for more one day.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice surprise for the newest, bestest hotel in causeway bay...”
Reviews.Author: Sannydy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this new hotel which we found thru the IHG family and friends rate facebook website. The only complaint or only an inconvenience for me was the unavailability of connecting rooms which was nicely explained to me but everything else was great, in room mobile phones you can use within hk, a great desktop charger that charges any brand of cellphone you can ever own, free fast broadband in-room access, flush usb port, a great phillips bedside clock, new and classy bathroom fixtures and a nice surprise, a sliding panel which reveals the glass shower panel enclosure. Better than my star last year at the excelsior. Location was also great as very near times square and shopping areas, my kids love going to the 2nd floor club lounge for their drinks and snacks, only if they provide more hot snack it would be perfect. Check-out was quite prompt and efficient, the heated swimming pool was excellent with excellent views all around and the daily buffet breakfast was quite good for a four star hotel. Definitely the best hotel in causeway bay now in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “nice, high tech surprice”
Reviews.Author: expat72
Reviews.Content: I was not sure if i shoud book a room in this hotel, bacause of lack of opinions - I found only two of them. Today - I am sure that it was great decision - nice, well equipped, modern and new room was a nice surprice. Frendly staff and great view from roof-bar was the same like photos presented.

Reviews.Title: “Nice addition to Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: MingBG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 4.5 star, nicer than I thought a Crowne Plaza would be (perhaps they've upgraded the brand). Although the lobby is small and modest, the rooms are plenty roomy, and that includes the bathroom too. Everything is brand new at this time, and the service is excellent to boot. The hotel is only 15 minutes' walk to Happy Valley, 10 mins to the race track and sporting grounds, and mere minutes away to the heart of Causeway Bay - Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Causeway Bay area”
Reviews.Author: changky
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in the Causeway Bay area, and I must say that my stay at the new Crowne Plaza is the best one yet! It's quite new, opened just 2 weeks ago, so everything is still fresh. The room is great --- modern yet functional. It's a bit small, but that goes for all hotel rooms in Hongkong. The bathroom though is big! I love how they used one glass door for the bathtub and the shower. Best part of the room - the 40+ inch flatscreen with dvd player and 5.1 surround sound speakers! It just looks great on that wall. Great location also....just a few blocks from Times Square and the MTR Station. The rates are a bit pricey in my opinion, and for a solo traveler I think it's a bit too much. Good for couples and families though. For solo travelers, I would still recommend Cosmopolitan Hotel or Holiday Inn Express which are located a few blocks away. Good tip btw - I booked in advance a round trip airport shuttle bus by calling the hotel desk. They charged 280HKD (140/way) to my room bill. But when I arrived at the airport, found out that you can book on the spot at 220HKD round trip. These buses don't get full, so it's ok to book when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just beware of converstion rate pitch at checkout”
Reviews.Author: jjhung88
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay there. The room and service were great. The location was good, very close to Times Square where they are plenty of shopping and eating, and subway entrance. Good room size, very nice design with glass shower stall that can see through to the room but can be closed with wall panel for privacy. They were still working out a few minor kinks since it just opened but overall I would have given a 5 star if it weren't for the "scam" at checkout. When we checkout, the clerk asked if we'd like to lock in the US$ rate so we don't have to wait for our credit card to convert as the rate changes daily. We thought that would be good so we went ahead and accept their US rate. In hindsight, we should have asked what was the conversation rate they used. It turned out to be 7.47, far from the average of 7.75. In fact, our credit card used 7.749. So don't fall for that pitch about locking in your conversation rate!!! That's the only reason I gave a 3 start.
